name: Julius Breckling Riverfront Park
address: 400 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: This is a really nice park. Kids will really like the climbing area. Parking can be difficult at times. One tip is to park on the other side of the river and walk across Junction Bridge. Not only is it free parking, but more than likely you might have visited the bridge anyway during your visit. The bridge leads right into the heart of the park for easy access.

The care that has went onto this park is amazing. Every where one looks you can find the most amazing art. Around every corner is a new discovery. There are two pedestrian bridges that link the the North Little Rock and Little Rock sides of the Arkansas River.

Be sure to walk towards the Clinton Presidential Center and find the great wetlands bridge and educational walk.

An amazing park with a lovely playground as well as a nice historical walk. Has many different historical attractions integrated within the walking path as well as having many different statues. I've came here many times in the afternoon as well as 1 or 2am in the morning. I've never had issues with bad people here nor any feeling of danger.  Great place for kids and family
Beautiful park that overlooks the Arkansas river. Also has a good look at the U.S.S. Razorback a submarine that served in World War 2. Got a little crowded during the evening.

This is a great spot to visit for some history of Little Rock as you walk along the river. You also have the opportunity to stop by the local shops and eateries just a short distance away from the park. This is a great area to take pictures. The family will enjoy the walk and there is a park gym that the children can play on When it is warm to hot outside there is a splash fountain or park that the kids can play in and run through. This is centrally located from several hotels and restaurants nearby and other local attractions. The Museum of Discovery is nearby for the family as well.

name: Big Dam Bridge
address: 4000 Cook's Landing Rd, North Little Rock, AR 72118, USA
reviews: It’s a cool bridge so you can’t expect much ,but it’s a unique experience for people driving by. On the side where Burns Park is its very friendly for bikes on the side. Especially since there is many good views to look at. In the middle of the bridge is a big water stream. It’s nice seeing the massive amounts of water go down the bridge. On the other side of the bridge is not as bike friendly for it is fairly steep ,but if you really wanted to you could go ahead and go.

Absolutely mind blowing how big the bridge is! Quite a modern marvel to visit! I always enjoy taking in the view from the center of the bridge. Definitely a place of interest for tourists, especially if you've never seen a river this large. I know the Mississippi River is bigger, but Arkansas River is still quite a sight to see. Arkansas is such a beautiful state!

I love love love walking across this bridge.. It's our go-to place for an afternoon walk.  On hot summer days it's nice and breezy!  Have had some real jerks on bicycles speed past with no warning which is no fun..

My favorite place for outdoor fun or a nice run. It is a central point of the Arkansas River Trail. The east view at sunrise over the Arkansas River is beautiful and equally matched with the west view which includes Pinnacle Mountain. It is well lit in the evening and there are benches at the top to just sit an enjoy. The distance across is almost 1 mile.
Great place to walk and get the heart rate up. Too bad people don't pick up after their dogs or it would get five stars.

name: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site Visitor Center
address: 2120 W Daisy L Gatson Bates Dr, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: Everything is so we'll organized. Anything you want or need to know about the struggles of the past is located here. Enlightening and sad at the same time. My heart is full of joy for what is. And perplexed by what was. Blessings are so real. TGBTG🙏🙌 GIFT SHOP IS INCREDIBLE👍👍👍👍👍🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗

Absolutely mind-boggling to think that it wasn’t long ago that schools were segregated. 
The school is beautifully built and still in use today. The architecture alone is magnificent. The history behind this building adds to the feeling of reverence I felt when visiting. 
The visitors center located across the street displays the history of the site and offers a wide variety of items for purchase.
Excellent tour. Well informed park rangers. I learned so much history.

This museum highlights great work in the continuous struggle for freedom and equality in our shared American Experiment.

The exhibits can we enjoyed from anywhere to 30 minutes to up to 2 hours. 

Also there are several book titles available in the gift shop as well as National Park passports, stamps, t-shirts, postcards, etc.

The staff are very friendly and helpful. They're also clean restrooms which are easily accessible by the physically disabled.

Just across corner to the visitor center is Central High School which is still a functioning for year senior high school. If you wish to go on a tour it is an necessary to call ahead and or go online to sign up for the tours which are only available twice a day.

Across the street you can see the fully restored filling station which offered the public telephone which the media used at the time.

 I'm so grateful to the National Park Service for this facility which offers education and reflection on difficult and painful journey our fellow Americans have beared and the good we have all benefited from despite powerful forces that desire to keep us mired in hatred, divided and suffering.

See you on the road,
📸 🙋‍♂️@gabrielcraft.me
Loved our experience at the central high school. Great knowledgeable rangers who give you much more insight than the textbooks share.

name: The Witt Stephens Jr. Central Arkansas Nature Center
address: 602 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Cute little place to visit if you're in the area. We spent about 20 minutes here. It's free, so don't expect a whole lot. It has a small aquarium woth some interesting fish, and turtles. Very educational spot with lots of small historical items. The gift shop has cute items for kids and adults at reasonable prices.

This place is so much fun! We eat and hang out  in the food court at the River Market and walk over to see the fish while we are there. My 8yo daughter loves to find all the different fish listed and feel the fur of all the different animals. My 2yo enjoyed it also, watching the fish, especially the leucistic (not albino) gar! It is so neat!!
It is nice to see. Informative for kids. Its a small place

Great place to learn as an adult or Explorer with kids of all ages. All at no cost. All funded by the Arkansas Game and Fish Commission (I think 🤦🏾‍♂️)

For Local Business Owners: Contact me if you would like me to visit your establishment and give an honest review.

....OR if you would like a free online/social media audit which will highlight some areas where you can improve.  I'm here to help. 🤝
Prettiest and different flowers. I’ve learned more about gardening just from watching how/when they plant.

name: Old State House Museum
address: 300 W Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: What a wonderful place to enjoy strolling around looking at items that are apart of historical events. The Museum has some old fashion flair and could use more interactive features like holograms life of old presidents or just Arkansas in general..The best part this place is free to enjoy on a nice day when you walking the Downtown area I definitely recommend this place as a hidden gem.
Informative, and interesting. They could make It a little more fun, more personality with staff would be good. I enjoyed it, especially the gowns, and hand made blankets.

The grounds were beautiful and had a couple of exhibits. The museum itself was free if I'm not mistaken and we wandered through the whole place. Arkansas has spent a considerable amount of money on this building and I highly recommend that you visit if you're in this area. There is a lot to do in this immediate part of town but it only took us about 20 minutes.

Thought was the state museum.. just hx old state house. Some artifacts mainly boards with pix..  skippable unless a political fan.. could be great... wish more like PA state museum. In cool area off the trolley line.. love the trolly.. close to the water.. really nice staff..

It isn't action movies, but it is history! Marvel at the elegant architecture and beautiful furnishings, and then lose yourself in the extraordinary heritage of early Arkansas and the people who shaped the future!

name: Historic Arkansas Museum
address: 200 E 3rd St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: This is an amazing place to learn about history. They had beautiful quilts. Gorgeous hand made knives and a section on American Indians. You can choose to pay $2.50 to see historical buildings. One that is said to be oldest in Little Rock. Excellent experience. Don't hesitate to go.
You will always learn something on the tours of the older construction, and the attached museum has incredible exhibits and connections rotating through.  A true gem.

This is actually a great museum. It’s got two sections. The first is an 1800’s village that you can take guided tours of for a small fee ($1.50), complete with a print shop, pub and some other cabins and houses. The second section is the main museum itself (free), with tons of exhibits, ranging from artifacts from the daily life of early Arkansans, Native American artifacts, Civil War artifacts, early exploration artifacts, and more. Definitely a good stop when you’re in historic downtown.

Absolutely loved this museum! It's free to tour the gallery and they have guided tours for a small fee. The gift shop has lots of interesting little items. I picked up a very tiny mason jar of honey and a bat magnet. The artwork and artifacts here are pretty tame so its a good place for kids. I highly recommend checking it out.
The place is huge with some awesome art. Very cultural and I appreciate it!

name: Rock Town Distillery
address: 1201 Main St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: Had a good time on a tour here - and delicious samples at the end. Learned a fair bit from our tour guide, too. I recommend both the tour and the spirits, which they sell seven days a week.

It’s just gorgeous and absolutely amazing selection. it’ll blow your mind beautiful indoor setting. The service and staff are  awesome they bend over backwards for you.  Just an absolutely amazing selection located in a beautiful section of town it’s a must if you like your Bourbons and vodka.

What a very nice distillery! Tour is good, tasting is excellent of all their products. I'm a bourbon lover but wound up buying their whiskey cause it's pretty damn Good! They have a nice bar area on site too. Nice to be able to have a tour and then spend some time at the bar

Tour was great! It was over an hour long so you def get your moneys worth. You also get free tastings which was awesome!  They have delicious cocktails. I had the drink of the week and it was fantastic! Only $5 too! The place is very clean too. We will be back!
For connoisseurs great experience. Loved every bit of the tour.

name: Mac Arthur Museum of Arkansas
address: 503 E 9th St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: A nice little museum showcasing US military, especially in reference to Arkansan military. This is one of the oldest buildings in Little Rock and is the site of many important Arkansas events, such as the start of the Civil War in the state, as well as the birth of General Douglas MacArthur. It’s got some decent exhibits on all manner of wars where Arkansas citizens are involved, as well as some on the acclaimed general and the suffragettes. Best of all, it’s free admission. Might as well go if you’re in the area.
Learned some Arkansas history.  I just recently moved here.  The historical objects were artfully displayed.  Our docent was informative.  Cool building and grounds.

Birthplace of Gen. Douglas Mac Arthur in 1880.  Its a Great museum to the early history of The Arsenal in Little Rock , which was used as a frontier Arsenal and Command camp for AR and FT Smith. In the time when the AR became a state and it closed in 1890.  
Holds  military artifacts from 1840 to 1970 
And Gen Mac Arthur memoribilia.

" An old soldier never dies , they just fade away."   God Bless all , safe travels.
Went on a trip with a bunch of friends and we had a great time! Loved all the exhibits and the little presentation we got at the beginning :)

This museum has something for everyone! Civil War, WWI, WWII, Vietnam. I especially loved the room with war posters. If you like a guided tour there's even an option to call a phone number for one as you walk around. Definitely recommend this museum if you're in the area and love history.

name: Esse Purse Museum & Store
address: 1510 Main St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: What a fun lo a gem! Museum takes about 20-30 minutes to walk through and a fun little stop! The store has many unique purses, wallets, and jewelry! Great stop in Little Rock! Staff is super friendly as well! Gave great reccs for local places!
Cute shop.... DON’T waste your money on the museum part

What a treat of a Museum with lovely hosts on a fabulous road in downtown Little Rock! 
I spent an hour visiting the Esse museum with my 3 little daughters and we were transported back in time and memories as I recognized handbags that my grandmother used, then the types of handbags that my mother/their grandmother used and finally the type of handbags I used as a kid in the 80's and 90's! My daughters loved the different stories and styles! My 8-yr old wanted to walk through the museum again and spend all her pocket money on handbags and jewelry in the shop full of eye-candy delights!! We will most definately return when my girls are a bit older for another fun mother-daughter date and shopping spree!!
Definitely worth visiting! For fashion and arts lovers this museum is a must! Well curated and interesting content about women fashion!
Fun place to spend 30-45 minutes. I brought my teenage daughter. I wouldn't pay to take kids though they wouldn't have appreciated it very much.

name: Arkansas Arts Center
address: 2510 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: Great venue for children's theatre. Since the remodel, the theatre is a nice place to introduce your family to the arts. I have also attended a catered wedding here...It was really nice.
I enjoyed this place a lot! Great pieces to enjoy throughout the museum. Best part? It was free!

The Art Center is a wonderful place. Their collection is varied, and wonderful. They have paintings by Monet and Picasso, sketches by Rembrandt, and a range of pottery, jewelry, vessels, and urns that range from a few hundred years old to a over thousand years old. They have rotating exhibits the feature a lot of artists that are from the area. The have a restaurant, gift shop, children's theater, and they offer amazing classes year round from woodworking to painting to making jewelry (metalsmithing). It's a must see place.

Dining at Canvas restaurant located inside the Arkansas Art Center was terrific. We held our sister's birthday party there. The manager and staff went over and beyond the call of duty. The food was excellent!
Great art center, a lot of diversity

name: Arkansas Inland Maritime Museum
address: 120 Riverfront Park Dr, North Little Rock, AR 72114, USA
reviews:
The Razorback tour was great! Our tour guide John was very knowledgable about the subs history and operation. It was really a treat to step back in time and see where the crew lived and worked in the original tiny home of the sea.
The staff at the museum are very friendly and helpful.
Nice little museum, it's a fun 2 hours to spend between stops. You get to tour the sub with a knowledgeable guide. Good times for an old sea dog and his kid.

Excellent ww2 submarine tug boat museum. Right on the river I say this is very cool. My 3 year old couldn't tour the sub (must be 5 years old). So we walked around the museum and tight boat while the wife took the rest of my kids for the 40 minute submarine tour.

My husband was extremely enthusiastic about this tour. I loved it too but didn't care so much about all the facts and figures. The size and where everything was stashed is what amazed me. Tour guide was very knowledgable.  We had a few questions that he was able to answer. I bought a book in the gift shop and it is one of the best books I've read (and I read continually). Bonus We saw about a dozen turtles on their shore.
This is a wonderful place to visit in Arkansas. We actually get get to go inside of a submarine and the tour. I would recommend this to everyone who goes to Little Rock.

name: The Heights
address: 5450 Kavanaugh Blvd, Little Rock, AR 72207, USA
reviews: The Heights Little Rock Neighborhood is truly a spectacular place to live work and play.   The Heights offers all of the above.  If you want it, check  out The Heights!  This new construction residence offers over 2 story, 3000 square feet, 4 bedrooms, 2.5 baths with the master bedroom on the main level.  Please inquire for more details.
It is so easy it makes you feel alive.
Side walks need work, probably why everyone walks in the street.. but beautiful gardens, neighborhood.
Great place for families.
I don't know

name: The Bernice Garden
address: 1401 S Main St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: It's a little hard to see from the street, so in this case watch carefully. Parking is somewhat limited, but that's pretty much everywhere in downtown Little Rock. We took a self-guided tour. If you aren't familiar with the plants, I suggest you use an app like Picture This or Bixby Vision to help identify the plant. If you're hungry the River Market is nearby, as is Community Bakery. Sometimes you can also find a food truck on or near the premises. On to the garden itself. I found it well maintained and quite peaceful for a downtown garden. It is not as big as I expected but if you have children or elderly family members with you, that could be a plus. It was a cold fall day when I went. I would love to visit the garden again in the spring! There are a few homeless people around, so just be aware of your surroundings and choose an appropriate time for your visit.

The Garden was fun tonight with a 70's theme and Disco music. Lots of folks who were too young to remember the decade were dressed for it and having fun!
 Sharon and I danced a bit and smiled the whole time. Join us next time!

This here place is what I like to call the garden of recognition and peace. Was just there around 3 days ago. I enjoy going here basically because every item there has a connection with all things that's in that area 🤔 So Be it😉 as I was saying everything there shows a form of spiritual dedication and I enjoy going there listen to the soft music and watching the animals fly crawl and of course jump from tree to 🌲 all in all I like to keep in touch with such said places. It's in my Spirit to do so. And thinking on the spiritual subject, It's getting about round the time to check the locks foundation. I have one on the channel lock post also 😁😉😇💂🕴️👣💨

Such a neat place to stop and enjoy. 
Would be better if it wasn't a homeless hangout.
Really like this place, whether its when they have food trucks or farmers market. Love the live music, a lot of talent there. Close to some cool shops.

name: William J. Clinton Library and Museum
address: 1200 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Even though I didn't care for him or his wife, this is a really nice museum with lots of photos and history. It's a rip-off to get a photo at the (reproduction) resolute desk in the Oval Office. If you want a photo it's $15.00! ridiculous. Since this is supposed to be history.....how about something along the lines of Monica.....that was a big piece of history that was conveniently forgotten to be added.
Every time I visit. I see something new. Great place to get some great history on the 32nd president and the first look into the bridge to the 21st century.

Food in the restaurant was good, and the grounds on the river were beautiful in the fall, however the museum itself was a snoozer.  Very boring.  It needs to be updated with some interactive displays or something interesting besides letters from celebrities.  The Foundation room was closed.  Didn't take long to go through it.
We had such a fun time visiting here today.  We were especially excited to see the 90s exhibit that is currently here.
Modern architecture. Endless information. Great exhibits that are always changing. The presidential library is a must see.

name: Mosaic Templars Cultural Center
address: 501 W 9th St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: It is a beautiful historic museum. The staff was accommodating.  There was some difficulty with light during our induction ceremony,  but it was solved within mintutes.

Clarity and fascinating displays of honor, care, and devotion into moral psychology that I lost for two hours and haven't been able to get all the way to the end of the displays. Definitely worth returning to more than once.
Extremely informative, the guided tour was well paced and allowed for time to explore the exhibits for yourself. The third floor has a nice ballroom for large events.
It's a very education place I learned a lot of new things I didnt know

The Mosaic Templars Cultural Center is housed in an incredibly beautiful old building in downtown Little Rock.  There are galleries, a theatre, and a gift shop within.
It is free to tour and also hosts a variety of wonderful events and productions.

name: H.U. Lee International Gate and Garden
address: 101 E Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: It's a small, yet scenic garden. A peaceful stop for those who practice ATA taekwondo, and others!
This is a very interesting place to see. Very calming and relaxing. Interesting story of the entrance.
An incredibly reverent and serene location to sit and be. Quite the memorial, I wish I had met the man it represents. Visit if you can.
Great place too sit, rest and meditate in the busy city. The best parking directly across the street only $3 for first hour. Or a short 15 min walk from free parking! Pet friendly with leash!

A special place to all members of the ATA, but also has some unique features of Korean culture that can only be seen here or in South Korea with some specially authorized statures that were imported just for this garden. 
See the history and legacy of ATA's founding members and high ranking masters.
Also the site of the ATA Masters Ceremony for the past several years. A worthwhile trip for all martial artists of Korean training and especially ATA Students.

name: Museum of Discovery
address: 500 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Very reasonable membership. $85 for 5 family members. Staff seems friendly and pleasant. I take my 1 year-old son almost everyday.  Kids Play room have a nursing room with a changing table which I think it's great! Normally there is a staff at each section so if you have a question they are there to help you. Machines are kept clean. Great place to entertain kids for few hours with no hustle.

The Museum of Discovery is a fun and imaginative place to go to. There is 3 floors of fun like a bed of nails, a robot Spirograph, and a room with a presentation what it’s like to be in a tornado. The museum is especially fun with kids because they get to experience new things. They have so many things you can’t do them all. An overview of The Museum of Discovery is that if your near the museum I definitely recommend going the here. It’s a very fun experience.

Wonderful place. In homeschooling my 6 year old and this is one of those places I look for in every city to give her ideas and inspiration to discover how modern technology works. We really our day as a family discovering new things.

Great for kids. Especially younger ones. Only a few displays get updated though so you can't go regularly. I am sure this comes down to funding and they do what they can do if you have the money to make a large donation I recommend doing it to benefit the kids interested in science.

Really fun. My girlfriend and I are 30 and we had fun for an hour and a half checking everything out. This would be a great place to take kids for a few hours to learn about science in a fun way. Just a heads up, the tornado simulator is fairly loud.

name: Burns Park
address: North Little Rock, AR 72118, USA
reviews: Great soccer complex and running/biking trails
We always have a great time at the park. So much to do and see.
Nice long trails to explore with ur family, bridge, soccer fields, baseball fields, concerts.
They took out the original batting cage
Great place to take your kids and have family time

name: Pinnacle Mountain State Park
address: 11901 Pinnacle Valley Rd, Roland, AR 72135, USA
reviews:
I love nature/outdoorsy activities but the bugs hate me.  My first time was in 2005 through the east summit trail, tougher hike. I accidentally kicked a wasp's nest and got stung on each leg.  The east summit has bigger rocks and can get quite steep-- getting on all fours would be recommended. We took the west summit trial this time (1.5 miles total).  There were bumblebees swarming everywhere, but didn't get bit (thank goodness).  Unfortunately, I went after a  night of drinking and so it took us over an hour just to reach the top (due to multiple breaks) and only 30 minutes going back down. I thought the hike down would be scary due to some steep inclines, but it was fairly quick and easy. There are small loose rocks than can make you slide and sprain an ankle so look where you are stepping. I slid, but thank goodness it was a light fall.   It's best to pay attention to the yellow painted rocks/trees and it guides you where to go and probably the easiest way to hike.  Luckily my friend knew to stick to the left coming up as it is the easier, less steep hike.  The trails are laid out with rocks to step on (some may be slippery due to some sand), but for the most part, the path is clear-cut.  There is an area where you hike up nothing but big rocks (that was the fun part for me). It can get dangerous.  I somehow ended up bleeding from a large scratch, but I was probably too tired to feel a scratch on my leg. I didn't notice this until after the hike was completed.

The hike, overall, was pretty much shaded thanks to the trees, but unfortunately the summit is not.  Once you reach the top you're fairly tired and want to rest, but if you go on a 100-degree day like we did you cannot sit up there and enjoy the view for long. I ran out of Gatorade by then. The view is worth it!   I enjoyed it and would like to hike it again in the fall.  Pack plenty of water!
A nice quiet place to relax, hike, fish, boat, and just be...chill. Plus the roads are great! It looks amazing! Go see the view from the top of the lookout!
Great spot to get outdoors without having to drive too far out of the city. I like going on weeknights to avoid the crowds. The East Quarry trail is my favorite!
I love this place. Lots to do in the park. The climb is not too difficult; beautiful views from the top. It's just a steep uphill walk with no climbing skills needed.
Climbing Pinnacle is an experience that every able Central Arkansan should try at least once.  There is a reason you see so many selfies from the top--it's truly gorgeous.

name: Little Rock Zoo
address: 1 Zoo Dr, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: For Little Rock not being a big city (I'm from San Diego where the zoo is world renowned), I am very impressed by this zoo. They are always making it better. We got the annual pass this year and it is a great value! Lots to see, clean and fun environment. The kids love it!

Fantastic zoo! Great staff and beautiful animals! This park is easy to navigate. There is a great restaurant to eat lunch and cool off! Very kid friendly with a little kid zone, which contains slides and other play equipment. There is a train that runs through the zoo as well. The animals are close enough to see easily and take great pictures!

I’ve been to my fair share of zoos and this zoo is amazing!! I was so surprised going for there for the first time. They have so much there, it is very nice, and the staff is friendly. We ended up buying a season pass on our first visit. A great place to take kids of all ages in Little Rock!

The zoo is awesome and seems to always be renovating to make life for the animals the best as possible. One interesting thing about the Little Rock Zoo is that a lot of the animals they have are geriatric and the staff takes awesome care of them. The staff is also great about educating guests on the various animals located at the zoo and answering any questions you may have.

What a Great time at the Zoo.
Perfect weather on a Sunday afternoon. $12.95×2 Adults was very affordable. Scenic train on a random schedule due to overheating issues. Soda machines everywhere. Bring quarters to feed the Koi Fish.
Me and a good friend walked around for hours. Hadn't been to a zoo in 25 YEARS. 
Bring your own lunch, the cafe was out of Coke & French Fries..gift shop is small, but not over priced.
$3/ Person for Mini-Train ride..
Great Job to the whole staff working..we shall return for a membership now..

name: Altitude Trampoline Park
address: 15707 Chenal Pkwy, Little Rock, AR 72211, USA
reviews: Great place!! Fun, wide open and tons of room to jump and play! Friendly, awesome staff! Much more affordable than other so called trampoline parks. This one actually has TONS of trampolines plus lots of other stuff! Kids loved it!!
This is an awesome place. Everyone loves it. No more specials or discounts. It was empty when we went. Had the whole place to ourselves.

First of all the kids love it. They had me drive to Little Rock from our hometown of Searcy rather than going to Conway. I understand that Conway has a similar trampoline park. This particular trampoline park is huge. It has dozens and dozens of trampolines and activities associated with trampolines. There are virtual reality games, basketball goals video games, etc... there are a lot of family size picnic tables that you can set it to have your pizza, nachos, chips and candy that you can get at the snack bar at pretty reasonable prices actually. They have bottled drinks and believe it or not the bathrooms are pretty clean. You would think with hundreds of kids coming to this place daily bit by this time a day which is around 7 PM and our close on Sunday, that the bathrooms might be disgusting. Well anything but disgusting they actually smelled nice and are very clean. Sure you’re going to see a little paper laying around here and there but the men’s bathroom is actually clean.  The price was basically $20 for two hours per kid. Plus there’s a new added bonus of that you must buy a pair of their traction socks or grip socks and an additional two dollars per kid. This is a little different than most trampoline parks. Most trampoline parks will let you use the socks you bring The price was basically $20 for two hours per kid. Plus there’s a new added bonus of that you must buy a pair of their traction socks or grip socks and an additional two dollars per kid. This is a little different than most trampoline parks. Most trampoline parks what do you use the socks you bring., Then The grip socks at two dollars each are optional. Not crazy about that , But I understand you need to create various streams of revenue to operate a business. It’s set me back eight dollars plus tax so not too bad I guess. One thing I do like about this trampoline park over the other ones I’ve been to is I can actually hear myself make this review while using voice text. There is music but it’s not so loud that I can feel it in my teeth. Don’t get me wrong I like music but they figured out a good balance for us parents who want to watch videos or TV on the phone while we wait for the kids.  I understand they have party discounts as well or group discounts. I’m not sure about the pricing on that but I know if you give them a call or check their website you could most likely find out easily. If you’re in the little rocky are you or what we are 50 miles away and decide you want to try a trampoline park give Altitude a shot I think you’ll be happy. And I know the kids will be.....

No rules enforced and big kids were running full speed and tackling each other. Plowing into the little ones, pushing them out of the way. My kid got plowed and didn’t want to go back in the trampolines by herself. No employees anywhere to control unsafe behavior. Someone threw a crushed water bottle on a trampoline and it was there until I picked it up. The bathroom was beyond disgusting. It could be a great place if their own supposed “rules” were enforced and the bathroom was sanitary. The trampolines are fun.

My boys love coming here. Staff is friendly and helpful. Always clean! My boys have a blast everytime we come. Love the socks 😉😁 and the boys think its awesome they get to take them home. I do wish there was different music played more kid friendly.. like 93.3 the fish. Or klove so its all positive and not promoting sex and  worldly activities  that would be my only request.  We need more Jesus in this world . Especially for our children. Amen.

name: Central High Museum
address: 2120 W Daisy L Gatson Bates Dr, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: Fascinating history and sad at the same time. Can’t believe what happpened in the late 50’s. We got the tour but we did not go in because of the corona scare going on! Bummer!
Grounds seemed to be well maintained as every national park is I have been too.  Tours are available of the high school along with many audio visual historical documentations.
Awesome trip! Our NPS Ranger Randy gave great presentation on the history and importance of this site! He brought it to life...feeling history is always better than just reading about it.

There were news reels of the event where the kids were barred from entering the high school based on race. No thought how smart or interested they were in learning. Pictures of people obviously making their life uncomfortable.  Hopefully those people realized their error later in life. The barred kids acted courteously and refused to meet hate with hate. Non-violence worked for them. Those kids and parents were BRAVE.
This is a great museum for those interested in the modern American civil rights movement. For those of us who have witnessed that struggle, Central High is an awesome place to visit.

name: Arkansas Governor's Mansion
address: 1800 Center St, Little Rock, AR 72206, USA
reviews: Beautifully decorated home. Attended an open house around Christmas time in 2016 with my grandmother. Mr. and Mrs. Hutchison were extremely friendly when we met them. We had a wonderful time seeing all the different rooms in the house. The place was packed and everyone seemed to be having a great experience. The staff members were all very professional and the grounds were kept well. Overall it was an extremely rewarding experience and I hope they will hold another event like this again sometime soon.
Wonderful Christmas decorations and a nice greeting by Governor and the first lady of Arkansas.

Very expensive home for a governor and not any tours available to the public. The Mansion is very big and very well covered by vegetation. It would be nice if they had a way to allow the public to get in and to park. Instead of shutting out the cut the public they should want to include the public. Can't wait to see if they do that.

Immaculately well kept grounds and manicured landscaping. This building is historically at the center of what happens in Little Rock and is filled with a busy schedule of galas, meetings, hosting and other events.
The mansion is gorgeous and the First Lady was so gracious!

name: Boyle Park
address: 2000 Boyle Park Rd, Little Rock, AR 72204, USA
reviews: Great place to go and enjoy the day. I love outdoors!
The park is so nice and relaxing. Good for kids and adults 😌

The park is really clean! If you are looking for a park that is pretty lonely, this is not the one for you! There is always people here but that's fine. The park is so big its almost like your the only one there. There are several pavilions and grills. You can fish here and walk trails. The playgrounds (there are about 2 scattered around) are amazing!! I've been here as a kid and still fascinated by how cool the playgrounds are.
Massive park so has a secluded feel even when plenty of people are around. Nice escape from the sounds of the city. Good for bird watchers.

Wonderful park. It has plenty of room for kids and many different family's to have their own space without bothering us. It also has a very peaceful trail, a great way to excape nd get a piece of mind

name: Two Rivers Park
address: 6900 Two Rivers Park Road, Little Rock, AR 72223, USA
reviews:
Had a nice time hiking down to the river, and spent some time in the kayak.I did find a nice little fishing spot. From 10 take 300 till you see a soccer park
Right across the street there is a boat ramp. Small though. Lots of crappie and channel cats. Liver is a must.
Great trails for walking and many friendly people too!

Nice park with several trails for jogging or biking. There are places you can park along the trailheads to access the trails and the river. Clean restrooms, posted trail maps, benches and a bike repair station. This park felt very safe and is well-maintained. Nice neighborhoods nearby.

My wife and I visited herefor a afternoon bike ride. It was absolutely amazing the scenery was gorgeous the park was very neat and clean. A train came by on the mountainside it was beautiful. We definitely recommend this park for biking and walking
Great Park! It is close to town but feels remote. The paths are paved and frequented by bikers, runners, and walkers. So everyone should feel safe and welcome.

name: The Old Mill
address: 3800 Lakeshore Dr, North Little Rock, AR 72116, USA
reviews: The Old Mill is a old place that’s great to spend the afternoon any day. The mood of the Old Mill is very relaxing and you can’t get mad there. The bridge ,the mill, and even the entrance are all charming to go to on a good day. I recommend going to the Old Mill if your in the area. It’s a good place to relax to.

Stopped for lunch in Little Rock on a road trip- DEFINITELY worth the slight detour!
  I loved this spot & can't wait to come back when it's warm (Still worth checking out in January!) 
  >5 min drive from the riverfront. Street parking in a neighborhood.

Beautiful historical park, nice paths, and views.  Artwork and sculptures are wonderful and imaginative.  Some of the walkways and bridges are difficult to walk over for the disabled.  Wonderful place to visit for an hour or so.
Great historic park. Small but very beautiful with pond waterfall and bridge. The focal point is the old mill of course. The place is quiet and good for family for take some good photoessays there
We loved it here! Picturesque and quiet. Plenty of space to kill about and then a nice stroll around the stream! Such a lovely place!

name: Downtown Little Rock Partnership
address: 101 E Capitol Ave #106, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: FOOD TRUCK FESTIVAL WAS GREAT! Delicious food and the weather was PERFECT!

We only stayed here 1 night, but I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Little Rock. The location is convenient to the bustling River Market area. The hotel also has a shuttle if you prefer not to walk. The warm cookies they offer at check-in are wonderful. We stayed in a king room with a city view. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioner worked well. I like a cool room and I was able to keep it that way. The bathroom looked like it had been updated. There is no longer a tub, but a walk in shower instead, with tiling all around. Parking would be the only negative for this hotel. There is a large underground parking lot attached, but I had to circle several times to find a spot. Then it was quite a walk to the hotel entrance. They will validate your card, though, so at least it is free. All the staff was very friendly and helpful.
Love the Downtown area,there is so much to do and see. The murials on the walls are great.
I visited to look around and to see what's in the building. Never been inside. Curiosity satisfied.
Food truck festival was amazing! Can’t wait to go back next year.

name: T.R Pugh Memorial Park
address: North Little Rock, AR 72116, USA
reviews: Great place to come and relax while taking a trip back in time to the early 1800s. The scenery of the whole place is absolutely lovely. I enjoy places like the most while I'm traveling.
Beautiful place to take pictures. We will definitely be back when its warmer to get more pics taken.
Absolute beauty. Well kept. March 9 ...flowers, wildlife and bayou.

The old Mill, great place to visit and relax. The mill was featured in Gone with the wind,  just got a major upgrade to make the waterwheel work again, the path has a couple of bridges(made to resemble wood) to the mill itself, which has 2 levels, the stairs are on the inside. A couple of fountains have been added. The mill area is also part of a bigger lake, which has recently been drained and cleaned out and had renovation work adding some docks for the locals who live across the street.

We were disappointed in the Riverwalk Market area. It is great if you want food or drinks but shopping was VERY limited. The streetcar was nice. Showed locations of all the museums and it is free! All of the little parks are worth a visit. You probably won't need to pay for more than 3 hours parking though.

name: MacArthur Park
address: 1000 McMath Ave, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: The pond provides recreation for kids and adults who wanted to fish. They stock trout in winter and cat fish during summer. I would recommend not to feed ducks there as their huge population already of them.
Really great park with lots of puppies hut the water wasnt working so lots of the dogs who didn't bring water were very thirsty!
A very well maintained park.   We came here for the dog park but were impressed by the park in its entirety.
Awesome place to take a history lover. Great place to honor those who fought for our country.

This park is near and dear to my heart. I went to elem. school and lived near the park as a child. A lot of fond memories that i cherish. The park has changed over the years but the warmth and hospitality hasn' t.  I go back and visit every chance i get!

name: Burns Park Funland
address: 25 Funland Drive, North Little Rock, AR 72114, USA
reviews: My son always enjoys Funland. When went to Funland holiday express party to see Santa. The Santa they had was very nice and looked the part. The only problem I ever have with Funland is that they don't have enough employees so you have to wait for them to walk over to the other rides.

Place is pretty cool, always kept clean and is under new management. The new manager, Betty, is great. They have your family's best interest at heart. They recently just had the concession stand painted and are doing some work to the exterior. A lot of time and effort is being spent on the place. The city always keeps the park cleaned and mowed/leaves mulched, and its regularly patrolled by NLR police or even a state trooper from time to time. Not at all sketchy like it use to be. Funland kinda has that "festival" vibe. It's a welcoming place, so long as you come with your child, and you're not 30 trying to ride the attractions. There's even a dog park, one for large breeds and another for small breeds!

Oh my goodness what a great time we had today!! Poppa and Gammy sure enjoyed watching our sweet grandkiddo's having so much fun riding the Funland rides, (made for just their size) if you've not been with your grandkids or kids you should go! A $10 wrist band gives the kids unlimited all day rides!! That's an awesome deal... 😊 all the staff is so kind and ready to help where needed.. Thank you!!!

To begin with, the staff provided excellent customer service. They are extremely understaffed. There are about 13-15 rides, but only 3 people running around to attending the rides. You pay $150 for 10 kids attending party. Get 10 wristbands for unlimited rides for 2 hours. Well we didn't get to ride but 3.  If it is staffed appropriately, it would easily be 5 stars. I'll try again in the future.
Clean and safe park for kids of all ages.

name: Allsopp Park
address: 3700 Cedar Hill Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: One of my favorites just because of how many treasures I find. Plenty parking on off hours. I’ve gone at less busy times, so I don’t ever have a problem. Playground. Ball field. Pavilions with grills. Upper parking or unloading for pavilions only open at certain hours. Lovely creek with a cute little bridge. Dog poop bag dispensers with bags. Nice for a little walk or exploring through the woods. Heavy on mosquitoes at night and in the woods trail area. Trails link together and lead into neighborhoods. Honeysuckles make the place smell so wonderful when it blooms everywhere!

This is so awesome!  I've never seen a FREE "bike repair station"  like this before and it's genius!  All the tools are easy to get to but also are locked/chained to the station to prevent theft.   I have been seeing this for a couple weeks now but never would have guessed it was this!   Like I said before GENIUS!   "Gateway at Allsopp Park North" I believe it's called, but whatever it's really cool!

This place is a little treasure.  Nice trails.  Woodland.  And there's a little ensemble that regularly plays at noon.  Delightful to wander around with a musical background.  Get out in some nature and unwind.

My youngest daughter (19 months old) loved the creek that looks man-made. She seemed to really mellow out and enjoy the sun and the crystal clear water that was gently rolling  past the rocks that broke the surface of the stream from underneath. Shes usually a ball of energy and this place really seemed to soothe her.

There’s so much to do! There’s a small loop that’s paved that goes around the activity area, a larger “South” loop that’s about 1.3 miles that takes you on a forest walk and a “North” loop that you have to cross a street to get to but is more secluded. Zoom into Google maps just close enough and it’ll show you the walk paths. The loops start in the south west culdesack of the south west parking lot. 
Baseball diamonds, playground equipment, art, covered areas, and even a tennis court. Time here is automatically well spent just showing up.

name: Murray Park
address: 5900 Rebsamen Park Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: I have a tiny little Chihuahua who can't go into the big dog park they also have a small dog park there so he gets to get out and run around and have a good time we have a blast there.
This is a great park located on the Arkansas river. There are plenty of things to do here like biking, fishing, walking. They also have a great dog park.
Great place. I love it because I grew up with that part of LR, good memories and making more still today.

Great little park with fields to okay games and some places to explore. The old playground in the sand is gone (too dangerous?) so be sure to bring your own forms of entertainment. Perfect for flag football, volley ball, soccer, flying a kite, throwing a frisbee, etc.
Love the dog park.  It is nicely maintained and everyone is so welcoming!

name: President Clinton Library
address: President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Its beautiful
This place is so fun to visit and see all the gifts Clinton brought back from other places I never been to around the world.
Calm steady paced atmosphere, lots to see here
This place is awesome.
Great place!

name: Emerald Park
address: Marge Gardner Ln, North Little Rock, AR 72118, USA
reviews: Absolutely breathtaking Park. . Great place for photographers and videographers to come and get amazing photographs and videos. Not a whole lot of wildlife when we went, could just be the season. Great for walking running and biking also!
Place is huge and well kept with the off trail option and some great views. Look forward to exploring it more
Beautiful views! Going right at the fork gives you breathtaking views, the left side is a good jogging path.

Love this place for either a quick stroller ride with the toddler or the 7 mile loop connecting to the skateboard park.  The trail back up to the parking lot is NOT paved- so I end up carrying the umbrella stroller and the toddler up the switchbacks but it's not too bad.  Watch out for snakes
This park is gorgeous! The views are breath-taking, the trails aren't physically demanding, and the air is crisp and cool. Definitely going again!

name: William E. "Bill" Clark Presidential Park Wetlands
address: 618 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Wow . Plan on spending all day. A wonderful experience of history and architecture and true service to our country and nature walk and much more . Excellent example of a presidential library.  You will want to do it again.
Beautiful park, easily accessible from parking lot

Great place to have walks, photography, keep eyes on Map, difficult navigation from and to Freeway.
Free parking available. Nearby aquarium and other attractions.
Worth spending free time if you are visiting this city.
An extremely informative destination.  Attractive facility.  Great restaurant on site.
Nice, scenic park, best place to walk and relax in Littlerock Arkansas.

name: Over-the-Jumps Carousel
address: Zoo, Zoo Dr, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA

name: Kanis Park
address: 820 S Rodney Parham Rd, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: Can you clean the trail? The new highway has damaged the grass and flooded the trail. All just off the third base line of the baseball field.  That would be nice. How about a restroom? That would be better. And post a sign for dog controlling, would help also.,🌝
Beautiful fall afternoon
We had a fun skating around! The boys had a blast on the ramps and stuff!
I love kanis been skating here since a teenager.
Awesome park. Good peeps all around. Good vibes.

name: Conner Park
address: 13100 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72223, USA
reviews: Quiet, hardly used city park.

Excellent mile an a half! A park playground area for the kids. A nice size lake for fishing which is also a beautiful site to see!!! If the trail was 3+ miles this would be a perfect spot for all types of trail hunters.  I recommend this trial for first time, beginners and out of shape folks. It will give you a great workout if you tackle it at your physical fitness.
Great hiking trails and access to the South Ridge Trail. Seen lots of people fishing here as well.
Nice secluded trail off of Cantrell around hwy 10 good place to walk your dogs

Nice little park in West Little Rock with a fishing pond that holds small bass, bream, and catfish. Also has a few different trails to walk and explore. There is paved parking right in front of the park.

name: Lake Willastein Park
address: Maumelle, AR 72113, USA
reviews: Nice outdoor walk today. Easy to navigate there via Google Maps on a walking trail.
Theres much to this park. Plenty parking. Conveniently located close to one of the best laundromats in Little Rock. Great for exercising, playground, events, picnics, walking animals.
Love taking the kids or coming by myself. The trail is nice. The lake is pretty, and it always seems to have a cool breeze blowing.

So much to do here. Walking path, massive lake for fishing, picnic areas, play areas, etc. The city of Maumelle has done a great job of maintaining their parks over the years. This is one of my favorite fishing spots.
I've always enjoyed this park and it's well maintained

name: Burns Park Dog Park
address: 4200 Joe Poch Rd, North Little Rock, AR 72118, USA
reviews: Great park. Was a bit soggy after a rain, but the dogs enjoyed running​ through the puddles. Three large fenced parks accommodate small, medium, and large dogs. NLR parks Dept trucks drove by regularly, offering some feeling of safety though the park was otherwise empty in the late morning when I visited.
Good place for your dogs to roam around and meet other dogs.

Considering the amount of space available at Burns Park, it's a shame this area could not be quite a bit larger. McArthur dog park in downtown Little Rock is bigger with more dog-running space. Boulders are nice, but hurdles are are a disgrace.  

Still a spot to take your doggo off-leash, though.

I’ve visited dog parks from coast and this is one of the least cool I’ve seen. I don’t even mind that Pitt Bulls are not allowed. My problem is that it’s just three rather small pens divided by dog weight. So 25 lbs dogs can’t play with 35 lbs dogs? That’s just odd. In a huge park this is a very small space once it’s divided up into three fenced squares

Very well kept park. Liked that they had 3 sections divided by weight. Areas were large enough for plenty of run space and seating areas for while the pups play. Staff caring for area were nice and friendly.

name: Ottenheimer Park
address: Little Rock, AR 72209, USA
reviews:
It's likely you'll have the park practically to yourself; but, my nine year old son was able to befriend a boy on the playground and play a raquet sport with a wiffle ball and throw a frisbee.

This park is designed for handicapped guests. My son liked the globe net merry go round.

They are renovating the park. There is a nice walking path. We got to see the train go by covered with cool graffiti tags.

There are heavy equipment vehicles over at the Riggs Caterpillar dealership across the street to look at.

There are very tame geese and a nice pond.

The basketball court is usable. The tennis court needs an overhaul.

There's one built in BBQ grill.

I'm not sure what goes on at the nice looking activity center.

There is free City of Little Rock WiFi but it says to ask the host for login info.

I think this is what is good about Google Maps - I searched for a park close to Arch St.
It a good place to take kid's. They've remodel it look very nice. Just to go,and sit to get out the house.
Basketball court is big..perfect afternoon spot for the whole family
Nice park with a pond, walking trail, basketball court, and playground.
Grew up playing ball here

name: Mt Holly Cemetery
address: 1200 Broadway St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: I’m not morbid, but I love to visit old cemeteries.  There is so much beautiful artwork and sculpture.  I love to get a small glimpse of our beloved departed personalities.  Some of the graves date back to the civil war era.  This cemetery is very beautiful and well maintained.  It’s worth a visit if you are in town.
So much history so peaceful
Beautiful and peaceful cemetery.  We walked it looking for inspiration for a name for our child.  Adelaide.

name: Benny Craig Park
address: 4610 Gum Springs Rd, Little Rock, AR 72209, USA
reviews: The Fourche creek is beautiful. I loved walking along the trail and looking at all the cypress trees.
because it was an event we had a blast canoeing and fishing in the creek in the back
Ball feilds and basketball wth picnic tables.
Uneasy feel because a cop was posted there the entire time. And the lake water smelled bad
Very clean and great place for kids

name: Mills Park
address: 1003 Mills Park Rd, Bryant, AR 72022, USA
reviews: This park has a very nice play area for kids that is fenced in with lots of things to entertain them. Surface around play areas is padded. Restrooms are available in the play area.
Fun place to swim & chill out. Only $5  great deal , clean pool , life gaurds on duty. Cool fun slide & diving board.
We love this place. Great little park where you can play and walk a few trails.
Love the fact it's in walking distance from my home. The grandchildren love going there  and watch Gigi and Papa Shayne being big kids with them💯♥
Nice ,clean, lots of play area and fenced for safety and security. Definitely will return to play again

name: Plantation Agriculture Museum
address: 4815 US-161 South, Scott, AR 72142, USA
reviews: Great place glad the state of Arkansas was able to restore. Most of the stuff they have is a soon to be gone from history the way people know how farming is and was. Very neat stuff how they have decorated and put together

i'll make this simple. i have never seen i site like this so for me this was like a one of a kind place. i learn a lot from all the great exhibits and the employees are so friendly and made you feel welcome. i could of chatted with these ladies all day. i really enjoyed my stay here.  don't forget about The Ashley Alexander Plantation House & Scott Plantation that are only minutes away makes this a great day trip.
Great place to learn about agricultural history in Arkansas.  The staff was amazing and spent time patiently answering questions.
Great place to take the kids to learn about the history of agriculture.

This Arkansas State Park showcases the cotton industry in central Arkansas.  I learned what boll weavals actually ate and where the terms "high cotton" and "fair to midlan" come from. 
It's a great place to go see how a cotton gun actually works. Toltec is north if you want to see how the native Americans worked these soils, too.

name: Arkansas Korean War Veterans Memorial
address: Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews:
God Bless the Fallen on Both sides of this conflict.  May God guide the fate of Man with Faith , Hope and the most important .... Love .
" Love all as I have Loved You ".

A joint project between the state of Arkansas and the Korean government, this beautiful monument does not just honor Arkansans, but all American soldiers and Korean civilians who lost their lives during the Korean War. It is a wonderful piece of art, though it is ironic that it’s located next to Douglas MacArthur’s house considering that was the war that got him booted from the Army. It’s in a convenient location for students of UALR Law to visit, so I recommend stopping here as well as the adjacent house of MacArthur.
Remembering those Arkansan that bravely fought for our country!
ARKANSAS Korean War Veterans Memorial, Little ROCK, ARKANSAS
Un lugar bonito para estar con la familia o solo. Es tranquilo y muy amplio para realizar cualquier actividad física

name: B-17 Memorial Park
address: 1836 Grant 51, Sheridan, AR 72150, USA
reviews: Great place to tour and learn some history and honor the late crew that gave their all.
Really nice, clean little memorial park. Absolutley worth the drive! It's a great tribute to the men and women that have given thier lives for their country.
Very nice.wasnt expecting to be so beautiful. Very peaceful. Heart felt place
Well done, did  not know 2LT Dolan but he was a fellow Navigator. Nice side trip and worth the stop.
Well maintained and very nice memorial

name: Toltec Mounds Archeological State Park
address: 490 Toltec Mounds Rd, Scott, AR 72142, USA
reviews: A must see for anyone who is interested in the history of this country and Native Americans. This is a very important part of this country's past and should be seen by everyone. We need to do everything we can to preserve places like this before modern "progress" has destroyed all of these sacred sites to build cookie cutter subdivisions or mass production businesses.

A very beautiful place to go with family! Also, A good place to learn more about our beautiful state Arkansas!!

Fact:
- Did you know the reason our state is called Arkansas is because the french called the Qua paws Arkansans (meaning down stream people)

We enjoyed our visit here.  Super peaceful reflection on our history and lots of information in the museum.  Easy walking path around the mounds and along the pond.  We stayed on the paved path though could probably easily have done the other longer path with the stroller.   Really neat FREE experience!

Very nice park. Trails are easy to walk. The boardwalk area over the oxbow lake and next to the Cypress trees is especially nice. Visitor Center is very informative. Nice video. Very nice Park Ranger.

Wow! It has been years, when I was a kid, since I have been here. But this place is great. What little impression I had when I was a kid was blown out of the water by what we experienced today, we took the family of four, which included a five and a three-year-old out and we had a great time! We did half of the longer Trail before we had to get back to the visitor center to take the tram ride. The trail is nice, but where your Sun tan lotion and bug spray. The tram ride was a fun experience and the breeze from it was welcomed. Park interpreter Amy was amazing, great with the kids and very personable. Can't wait to get out here for a equinox or solstice program.

name: William Kirsch Preserve within Ranch North Woods
address: 8803 Ranch Blvd, Little Rock, AR 72223, USA
reviews: I expected this to be a tiny little area behind a neighborhood. But it is a lot larger than expected so I think I will come back out ready for a jog because it is a more flat area with nice scenery and a well kept path. While driving in it does look almost like you have to have special permission to come here but it doesn't seem that way after coming in. The entrance gate is just not very welcoming

What a great place to get out on some Black water!  Park and the dock is a 100 yards from the parking lot!  Great Little dock.  Paddle out a little ways and you’re right in the middle of the little Maumelle river.  Make a left and you can paddle down and see pinnacle mountain.  What a breathtaking view!  Bring a fishing pole and get ready to catch fish!  I have taking my mountain bike here as well!  Great Place to ride bikes!  Great hiking trails and beautiful places to have a picnic!
A pretty place to check out. When I was there today, the Arkansas River had the place completely submerged. Record flooding going on.
Short hike through the woods. Good low cut, light technical mountain bike trails through the fields. Secluded camp and sitting areas. Wildlife. Definitely worth supporting.
Awesome place for walking, enjoying the outdoors!

name: Butler Park
address: Little Rock, AR 72227, USA
reviews: Kids had fun, they still have a merry go round which is always a blast. It's a little small if your looking to enjoy a playground. It was clean and they do have usable tennis courts. It wasn't a very diverse park either.

I've always had fun in this park, small playground and a scattering of picnic tables. But the best part is all of the wonderful trees. Perfect for reading a book in the shade or just hanging out in a hammock

More spacious than it looks (from the road)! Creek and a bridge, bathrooms, water fountain, trash cans, playground, tennis court/bball court, green space to walk dogs and run around, lots of shade, just a few concrete picnic tables with a grill. Could use more benches/picnic areas. Wonderful area!
Lovely neighborhood park to give the kids an opportunity to exercise!
Nice playground, a lot of benches.

name: Jacksonville Museum of Military History
address: 100 Veterans Circle, Jacksonville, AR 72076, USA
reviews: It's been a long time since I last visited,  but it is a great place to go. Run by volunteers,  many of whom are veterans, you will find that this little museum has more to it than meets the eye. Jacksonville is mostly ignored by tourists, leaving this museum fairly empty, but I promise you will find no better place to pause at on your way to Hot Springs.
For 3 bucks to get in... can't complain at all. Nice displays and info from civil war to current times.  You could expect 1-2  hours here.
Awesome place to see.  Very clean and professionally run. A must see when in the area. Lots of exhibits .. big and small.  Volunteer staff.

This place is a gem!
Careful preservation and thoughtful museum for our armed services.
The museum is awesome so much history in the town of Jacksonville.

name: Enchanted Forest Trail of Lights
address: 511 Bear Paw Rd, Sherwood, AR 72120, USA
reviews: We take our grandchildren every year. Some are teenagers now and still enjoy it. The displays are beautiful! We did a Christmas light scavenger hunt this year, looking for specific displays (elf, gift, Santa, etc.). It is run very efficiently, but I reccomend going early to avoid the longest lines. You can't beat the free price, but I encourage you to donate well, as all donations go to new displays and keeping this wonderful Christmas event going every year.
A family friendly, cute event. It is free but they take donations and you should definitely donate a lil so they can keep bringing us these cool light creations!
Wait was long to enter. Very festive!
This is a free drive thru light display. Donations are accepted for future light displays. Arrive early or you WILL be in a very long line of cars! Worth a trip with the family.
Very pretty bit of wait but worth it !

name: Arkansas National Guard Museum
address: 6th & Missouri, Camp Robinson, North Little Rock, AR 72199, USA
reviews:
NOTE: You'll have to go into an actual National Guard Base. 
When going to the National Guard Base, be prepared for a background check, and make sure your car insurance is valid as they will request that as well in order to give you a guest pass. Finding the Museum itself can be a little tricky too, but google maps should be able to point you in the right direction. Drive safely through the base and respectfully, you don't want problems with local enforcement. Remember, you're on the grounds of a military base.
The museum itself is quite fascinating. They have all sorts of vehicles outside for you to observe and even touch (no climbing allowed, i don't suggest testing out your luck and climbing a tank in a military base... just saying). There's also an inside part of the museum which is just as fascinating as the outside.

This place is a great place to come check out. There's so much history there. I love to see how things was and compare what we have now. I feel like everyone should at least go here once to just see the history.
Amazing place
Military history your thing... This has everything you wast to see
Good displays and historical information

name: Tyndall Park
address: 913 E Sevier St, Benton, AR 72015, USA
reviews: Tyndall Park is a great place to take kids of all ages. They just added another brand new playground and fenced it all in so little ones can't escape. They also have basketball and tennis courts here along with a skate park so it really is a great place for everyone. Highly recommend taking your kids here sometime.

Got a nice upgrade recently and unlike Bryant they added new equipment in addition to what they already had.  Safe and has everything from a skate park, walking trails, baseball, splash pad and playgrounds.
Great day at the opening of the junior disc golf course. It is super fun, and more technical than it first seems. Great job Cedar Creek, and Benton Parks and rec for bringing this to the community.

Great park which includes toys for disabled children, splash pad, and skate park. Many area to play in! There is 3-4 play areas for different ages of children from toddler, kindergarten, and elementary aged children. Some area have shade which help on hot summer days!
Tyndall Park is a great place to take the kids. We go there often. It offers 3 great playgrounds and a splash pad. My kids love the skate park!

name: Centennial Park
address: 1850 W 16th St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: Nice, green, and well kept park with full court basketball & tennis courts. It's huge so you can come here and relax
I was there very late at night, no one there. Enjoyed the calm vibe. I now know there is a closing time on the park haha
Good place for kids to play
Need to be handicapped friendly,  needs water fountain, bathroom.  Not senior friendly.

I attended school there 1st grade through middle of 5th . Started there in Sept. of 52. The building had a large open area in the center, 3 floors high. It was a massive looking building. I spent a lot of time climbing in the big spreading Oak tree on the Wolf street side. Have a lot of good memories of the place.

name: Petit Jean State Park
address: 1285 Petit Jean Mountain Rd, Morrilton, AR 72110, USA
reviews: This is one of the most beautiful places in Arkansas.   Don't miss Cedar Falls.  The Stony House Cave is cool too.  I haven't been to very many of the other features of the park but I look forward to my next visit.  Great camping,  fishing,  hiking,  and just all around enjoyment of the beautiful surroundings.  Enjoy!!

Great hikes and activities available. We stayed in the yurts which were comfortable.  The walk to the showers and restrooms was not too far. The hike to the falls was a little steep in places but even our youngest hiker made it with no problem. The children have a nice time in the water from the falls. Canoes were a nice activity for those that chose to venture out. Biking around the area was also a big hit with the kids.

A MUST do if you are in the area! This is definitely one of the more busy parks, but for good reason. Once you get past the steeper part of the start of the trail, it is a fairly fast and flat walk to the waterfall. The restaurant and lodge are comfy, cozy, and have guest that are hard to beat! The restaurant has a fairly large menu that is absolutely fairly priced. The drive alone to get to the park is great! Must see!

A great spot not too far off the main way through the state if you're traveling through the area. I'm glad we found this park because I love waterfalls, and we happened to visit in the middle of February when they were flowing quite well from all the recent rain.

The Cedar Falls trail is pretty short and leads up to a great waterfall, but it's the most popular hike in the park so if you're wanting to avoid a lot of people go earlier or later in the day. If you have time, the Seven Hollows trail was nice, too. It also had fewer people on it, probably because of its length. The 4.5 mile trail is a fairly easy one, but bring water.

Absolutely INCREDIBLE state park. The best I’ve gone to. So much to do as it is such an enormous park. Hours and hours of trails to hike, including one that is 12 miles which I hope to get geared up for soon! If you’re near the area going hiking here is a MUST! Do not miss out! Even if you’re out of state looking for an amazing place to hike, GO HERE!!!

name: Cadron Settlement Park
address: 6200 Hwy 319 W, Conway, AR 72034, USA
reviews: Love walking my dog here. Great view of the Arkansas River. Has short hiking and mountain biking trail.
Well maintained grounds and hiking/biking trails. Beautiful scenery, all overlooking the Arkansas River. This is also a historical site with information posted throughout the park.
Great trails to hike and mountain bike. Scenic view for sunsets over the river, easy access from parking
Normally this is a great Park but right now you can't even get in. The floodwaters have taken over.
Authenticly reconstructed Blockhouse at point overlooking the Arkansas River. Pit toilets nearby. Tolantuska Walking trail in the park, and multiple mountain biking trails.

name: Laurel Park
address: 2310 Robinson Ave, Conway, AR 72034, USA
reviews: The best park in Conway! Great place for kids to play, we love to visit! The playground equipment is very nice & safe. There are parts for both younger & older children to enjoy. They have nice pavilions to rent for parties too. During the summer months we enjoy the splash pad located here.

Laurel Park is a great place to spend an afternoon! In the summer, the attached splash pad is a nice way to cool off, and a playground to warm back up. The grounds are kept clean, with trash cans readily available, Picnic tables for lunch, and pavilions to keep out of the sun. The trees offer a lot of natural shade a well, that other parks don't have. Beyond the splash pad and park there is a large level field to picnic in, play kick ball, Frisbee, fly kites, or just a walk on the trail provided! Great area!

This is a clean and wonderful place for birthdays or just a day at the park! It has a playground, water toys for the hot summer days, a track to run on, and an open field to play in also! Something for everyone at any age!

My kids love this park. Playground equipment for toddlers and older kids. Splash pad. Large open field. Tennis courts. If you play Pokemon GO there are several pokestops here and you can walk the loop and by the time you get back to the beginning you can start again.

This is my son's favorite park in the Conway area! There's lots of space for kids to run, a tiny slide for the littles, 4 buckle-up swings, 4 big kid swings, 3 big kid slides, plenty of stuff to climb on, and a free splash pad (like a water park without the slides) to play on during the summer! There's also well maintenanced bathrooms! (There's a men's,  women's and family bathroom, but they're usually locked on Sundays.) There's plenty of benches surrounding the park and lots of shaded area! 
Laurel Park is also super close to Patti Cakes, where you can take the kids to get a well deserved treat after playing nice with the other kids! And Patti Cakes is literally right next to Stobys, where you could take the kids for a filling lunch before getting a treat at Patti Cakes!

name: Hot Springs National Park
address: 369 Central Ave, Hot Springs, AR 71901, USA
reviews: This was such a nice relaxing place to be! The water was so warm, perfect bathwater temperature. While sitting next to this spring, you can almost forget that this is located right in town. There are a lot of nice walking trails in the park.  It is also nice to fill up a jug of water at one of the drinking water stations. There are at least two that we saw. It is nice to see the area from the nearby tower as well as go to all the nice shops, restaurants and hotels nearby. The one thing I was hoping to see more of was the natural springs other than the one pictured. We didn't  walk every path, so we could have missed something. I am sure most of the  springs are harvested to use in the nearby bath houses. Overall, it is very nice place to see  and worth a visit.

Insanely gorgeous area! The history is enough to warrant a visit. The fact they still have operating bath houses is even more impressive and is a cherry on top. Beautiful natural sites and the amazing geological marvel of the springs are a sight to behold. Without a doubt make your way to this amazing time of a place.

As far as a place to visit, it's alright. Learning the history of the area is kind of interesting, and visiting one of the bath houses for a spa is, once again, an interesting experience. But as far as National Parks go, this is an odd one. Since it had the label "National Park" I really expected something different, more nature. I would think of this more as a National Monument or something along those lines. I think that would have set up my expectations better.

I really loved spending time in Hot Springs. I really enjoyed the history of the bathhouses. We stayed at the Waters which was a great place. We walked around and had a private soak and a couples massage, which we really enjoyed. We were there for 2 days so we didn't get to explore as much as I would have wanted to. It was cold in December, so I would like to come back in the summer and check out the lakes.

The only national park I've ever seen that's center is also a town center. Also had walking trails where u could get off the sidewalks and onto the dirt for less traveled, crowded areas. Free access to fill your own containers from both cold and hot springs which was very cool.

name: Garvan Woodland Gardens
address: 550 Arkridge Rd, Hot Springs, AR 71913, USA
reviews: This was a fun place to go out with the family. Had a big group of us, and the trails and walking were pretty big. We barely covered 1/3 of the walkable trails and it was just short of 2 hours. We spent a good amount of time at the children's garden and waterfall to let the kids climb around and explore. It was damp when we went or we may have been able to explore more.

My family and I go every year, absolutely worth it. Great price point, and even though it can be a bit busy depending on times, it’s well worth it. I notice this last year they made it more handicapped friendly, offering rides. They also have snacks and merchandise stands. Lots of restrooms. Easy paths to navigate

Not much else to be said about a place already so highly reviewed. Stunning natural paths beautiful waterfalls amazing scenery and impeccable architecture. What else is there you need? Makes any trip to the region more than worth it. I know I'll take every opportunity to come back and see this beautiful place again.

Second time here and it is still as enchanting as the last. The flowers and accompanying trails frame the world a beautiful way. I highly recommend going when it's still cool in the morning. The walk is worth the price of admission and though hard as it may seem...try not to see the gardens through a camera lens.

Fantastic garden with plenty of plants and tree varieties from around the globe.  Great place to take children, with plenty of photo opportunities.  Our visit was in early March, but I guess it would be fully bloomed during late spring and summer time.

name: YaYas Euro Bistro in Little Rock
address: 17711 Chenal Pkwy, Little Rock, AR 72223, USA
reviews:
Love going to YaYas when I’m in Little Rock visiting family! The weekend brunch is awesome, copious but really awesome and it’s especially enjoyable when they have a jazz band playing. 
It’s a great place for family as their booths and tables are spacious and there’s something on the menu for everyone. We love having our girl gatherings here ❤️

Delicious and attractively displayed in a warm, inviting atmosphere. Loved our waiter who anticipated our needs with the added benefit of being very entertaining. You haven't lived until you've taken in their Sunday brunch!

Fantastic food -- the duck breast on the Chefs Special was perfect.  Excellent beverage list -- highly recommend the Casino Royal aka The Vesper martini for true Bond fans .  Beautiful restaurant setting with a great atmosphere.

A great downtown restaurant in West Little Rock -- don't pass it by, it's a gem!
Food is amazing, service is fabulous. I've always had a great experience at YaYa's!  Highly recommend.

Great for brunch! The selections were excellent and the service was friendly. It's only $22 and the options range from omelette/pasta stations, roasted wings, bacon, risotto, sausage, to prime rib and more... The mimosas are addictive so, bring a designated driver. I've been here twice and I shall return!

name: Brave New Restaurant
address: 2300 Cottondale Ln #105, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: This place was fantastic but it’s so weird to get there.  Would be a lovely spot in the summer time since there is an outdoor patio. Not featuring the steak sandwich but that was my favorite thing.  This place is absolutely worth locating even if it feels rather obscure.

Disappointing to be honest. Maybe my expectations were too high based on the good reviews I heard from some people. Service was very good though, attentive but not loitering around.
