Cool location near the river, probably great view when its warm. Went for dinner on Friday. We shared the wild mushroom tart for an appetizer; filling was great, crust was burnt and bitter. For mains we had the walleye ($37) and the duck with duck ($32). Each main came with a salad that was pretty basic, not bad but just a filler. The mains also came with identical sides of red cabbage, new potatoes, and patty-pan squash. The sides were just kinda tossed on the plate, squash was undercooked and flavorless, potatoes and cabbage just more filler. The fish was cooked well, saffron sauce was good. Duck was cooked medium and was flavorful, but the skin was not crispy. The sausage was a little sweet but alright. Wine prices were reasonable, but at $30+ for entrees I just dont think its worth the money.

This fantastic find is hidden away in an office building setting on the 1st floor.... above G floor.  As we got close, the signs and smells directed us the rest of the way.  A quaint, clean, and inviting setting overlooks the Arkansas River and pleases from the start.  The shrimp, avocado, and grapefruit appetizer was unique and very well presented and fantastic.  I had the walleye and it was superb, and another had the Reuben sandwich that was huge and unbelievably tasty.  I’ll be back sometime when I can set outside and overlook the river, eat endless appetizers at random, and have wine glass after wine glass.

Love this place. Fine dining with an awesome view of the Arkansas River. Guaranteed that every single thing on your plate is meticulously prepared and nothing was put there by accident. I’ve never had a dish or side that wasn’t amazing. The owner Peter Brave is always there mingling with the customers as well checking on you seeing what you thought of the food. Very special place to me and my wife. We love it here. Highly recommend.

Tucked away in Little Rock is a true hidden gem. Excellent service with friendly and welcoming staff! Delicious food with every bite.  Peter Brave personalizes the night by visiting every table and capturing your dining experience.

name: The Pantry Restaurant
address: 11401 N Rodney Parham Rd, Little Rock, AR 72212, USA
reviews: Great atmosphere in a small, quaint restaurant setting. Smaller seating areas that could get too full in peak times. The menu items are unique & fresh - the turkey sandwich & hamburger come in bread that is super fresh & looks even better. German cuisine is the spotlight - but the desserts are the hidden gems.
Our goto where everyone knows you name spot. Great Northern European food. Wonderful cocktails and some of the friendliest wait staff you will run into and the bar tenders are even better

Wonderful atmosphere. We dined on the patio. Great service. Our server was just the right amount of attentive, and explained all the dishes for us. And her recommendations where spot on. And the food, was a deligth. Every bite was amazing. We had the bacon wrapped date and the Deviled Eggs for appetizers. My daughter made a meal out of the smorgasbord tray. I had the Brat plate, and was happy as clam with it.  Had the Apple Strudel and the Crepes for desert to finish a great meal. They are lightly sweet and just a perfect compliment to all the different taste sensations of the meal.
We will be going again as we are wanting to try several other dishes. The house pate is great. They make most of what we ate in house and it just enhances the taste and over all meal experience.

The atmosphere and the food here are out of this world! You feel as if you have been transported to Central Europe! Comfort food Plus a fabulous staff! Bonnie our server has the best recommendations, and always a pleasant smile! Love her!! This place never disappoints!
What a great little gem! We had the Lasagna and it blew me away. We loved the environment as well. It was lively but quiet enough to have a nice conversation. The deserts were to die for!

name: One Eleven
address: 111 W Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: The food at this restaurant was so divine we had to go back for their brunch. Their shrimp risotto was incredibly creamy and so delicious. The scallops were perfectly cooked and the duck salad was amazing. The dining room looks like a French restaurant with their freshly pressed white tablecloths and the wait staff were all super nice and took great care of us. It's definitely a high-end restaurant and therefore not cheap but it was money well spent.
Had an amazing "anniversary dinner" fantastic food and fabulous service. Well worth it!

One of the city's best restaurants. 111 is a fine dining experience appropriate for any family, friends, or company dining event. From date night to dinner with out-of-town visitors no matter what time of day you'll find an exquisite menu offering the best ingredients in a most beautiful presentation. The breakfast is one of my favorite two locations in the city. The biscuits and gravy are excellent as well as the eggs benedict. For lunch, would recommend the Express Menu. Recommend making a reservation with the hotel concierge or online reservation system. Valet is available for the car even when not staying at the hotel.
The best homemade biscuits. They are so fluffy and light

Bottom Line: Excellent food and environment, but questionable service. 

This was our first time to visit One Eleven. We are massive fans of the Capital Bar & Grill as well as the general vibe of the hotel. So, we have always wanted to try One Eleven, especially after hearing such great things about their brunch. 

When we arrived, it took us about 10 minutes to get the attention of the hostess. In her defense, she seemed to be addressing some sort of a situation. Once we were seated, it took our waitress a good bit to come by. While she was kind, she was generally inattentive. 

Our food, however, was excellent. The eggs Benedict and the Salmon eggs Benedict were both spot-on, truly some of the best we’ve had. The coffee was also very good. 

It was an overall good experience; it was just a bit disheartening to feel like an afterthought to the waitstaff. 

We are going to give it another try at some point to see if the service improves.

name: The Root Cafe
address: 1500 Main St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: The Root Cafe is a fun little restaurant serving a solid menu of comfort foods and one or more specialty dishes and salads.  They also have a few vegan and gluten-free items to choose from. When the weather is nice you can make use of their beautiful outside garden. I had one of their homemade brats which I found to be delicious. Overall I would come back.

This is my new favorite place to eat.  The food is absolutely delicious, they have exciting combinations for your palate that linger in your mouth all day long. The energy and staff is so kind.  You feel good overall being there and when you leave. The best way to describe the experience is wholesome. Can't wait to come back!

Saw this featured on Diner Drive-ins and Dives a couple years ago and it's been on my list since. Great menu and colorful, kitschy decor. The food was great and the service was quick. My only reason for 4 stars is some of the staff was not on their best behavior. They seemed to be mad at each other and it showed in their interactions. We found a table right next to the kitchen so it was obvious there was some friction there. But overall,  definitely worth a visit when in Little Rock. Its popular with locals and tourists and with good reason.

Such a yummy place! Even if you aren’t into the whole “farm fresh” thing this place is a good stop! Our favorite drink we get every time we go is the blackberry lemonade... so good!! It’s always busy when we go which I’ve always noticed to been a sign that it’s a good place. I’ve had both breakfast and lunch here, both great!

I've heard from many of my friends about this place for some time so I decided to by for breakfast.  They certainly take a different approach what many consider a traditional breakfast as there are some options that no other place around offers.  Honestly it's a bold move but that's definitely hit or miss.  I had the biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon.  The biscuits and gravy were pretty good, slightly sweet but no complaints.  The bacon on the other hand.... I'll just say that I've had bacon bits that had more flavor.  Maybe it was just an off day but I think it was actually made ahead of time because it literally crumbled to the touch.  Even microwaved bacon would be ashamed to claim it as its relative.  But the service was very good!  Couldn't have asked for a nicer staff.  I'm not completely writing this place off but I had to be honest and my experience.  I'll go back again for a dinner service and will let you all know what I think of that.

name: Bruno's Little Italy
address: 310 Main St #101, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Absolutely awesome. Beautiful small bar. Went twice within the week. Delicious food, outstanding service and great location downtown. Definitely compares to New York Italian. Owner came out of the kitchen to see how our meal was.  The ravioli is amazing. highly recommended

Many people complain that Little Rock doesn’t have good Italian in the area. I couldn’t disagree more. I have lived in Manhattan and dined in the original Little Italy of the Bronx. Bruno’s Little Italy is every bit the best of the best of Italian cuisine. My New Years’ resolution is definitely to frequent Bruno’s more often. Service was impeccable! We also had cannolis and spumoni ice cream, but ate them faster than I remembered to take a photo! So delicious! The ambiance of Bruno’s is everything you want a homemade Italian cafe to be! Thank you!

Came down from Springfield, Missouri area to try this restaurant out.  Heard nothing but good things and this place delivered!  Their bread even tastes phenomenal and I am not usually a big fan of just bread.  They have a homemade sausage on spaghetti that’s to die for!  

We were down here on the first weekend when President Trump was considering the notion of banning domestic travel and this place was STILL busy!  Highly encourage you to get here early.  They have a bar across the street from them that has fun bar games if you come before they open up.  Well worth the wait!  Not to mention, the owners are amazing people and have quite the passion for making sure their customers are happy and satisfied!

My wife and I went downtown Little Rock to eat at Bruno's Little Italy on a Friday night in July. It was around 6:30 pm.   They do have valet parking for those that can't find parking.  The place was packed in the inside but we were the first people in line for a table.  We choose outdoor patio seating.  The atmosphere in the inside reminds me of a bustling Italian restaurant you see on television.  People moving really fast to go get orders or to place orders.  People seated at their tables laughing and having a great time.  The authentic Italian smell of Pizza or tomato sauce fills the air.  We were promptly seated outside.  they do have Italian music playing on the inside and outside which gives it even more authenticity.  My wife ordered an appetizer tray that was full of prosciutto, pepperoncini peppers, olives, many different cheeses, and sun-dried tomatoes.  I opted for the chicken cacciatore.  It did take a little to get the food probably around 30 to 40 minutes but it was well worth the wait.  I highly recommend this as a place to be with family and friends and eat really good Italian food we will be back.

This is a must do if you're in little rock, Vince is as humble as they come, it was a pleasure eating here, I'm thankful for triple D for putting it on the map.  The heritage, old world Italian manners and great food.  I'll be back says most people that eat here, me included.  Get there early, they open at 5 and all tables were full by 6.  Oh yeah, if you eat nothing else...you gotta have the toasted ravioli...it's outta sight!

name: Samantha's Tap Room & Wood Grill
address: 322 Main St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Food and drinks were amazing! The bartender, Jennifer, was super personable and the cocktails were bomb. Pictured is the quail and collard greens. We also had the champagne cake and waffle for dessert. My mouth is watering writing this review. The manager, Ashley, checked on us several times and was so friendly. She and Jennifer had us laughing all night and we felt well taken care of. We absolutely plan on going back soon.

WOW 🙏 My daughter and I came to Samantha's Tap Room. To celebrate her birthday 🎂🎉🎈 The wait was long. But the food, ambiance and loving service. Made for a memorable experience we will never forget 🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗 We are planning our next visit soon in the very near future 😊😊😊😊😊😊 We also saw our extended family here as well. Great minds think alike 👏👏👏👏👏👍👍👍👍

Everything was excellent! Saw all of the many reviews and we were looking for somewhere great to have dinner and here it was! We had the surf and turf queso, fried green tomatoes, wood fired grilled shrimp, lamb chop lollipops, Cuban sandwich, chicken and sausage seafood gumbo and pork skins. It was all simply wonderful!

This is a great restaurant and craft beer place in downtown Little Rock. It's an easy walk from the Marriott. I got the ribeye steak, which is grilled in their wood fired oven. Packed with flavor and cooked just right. We were in an upstairs room for a group event. Service was good. The overall vibe is energetic and fun.

This is a great place for a special dinner or date night! The restaurant is beautiful and the staff is very knowledgeable. All of the dishes I had were so delicious and I will definitely be coming back!

name: Layla's Gyro
address: 9501 N Rodney Parham Rd #7, Little Rock, AR 72227, USA
reviews:
Well my wife suggested that we go to this spot I was not that interested because I had a taste for a burger. I am glad that I decided to just go with her suggestions. (Who knew listening to wife was a winner)

From the moment we stepped in the establishment a calming vibe came across of me. Now I  have had gyros before. (Who hasn't?) This place did not only made me realize that I had very cheap copies to the point I will be forever unable to accept the lesser versions. 

I also realized that the American policy that salt is a  season is unfounded and leads us to miss out on actual seasoning. The Rosemary Pasta (or the Olive Garden slayer) had so much taste I wondered if I can just buy the sauce. We all have experience bland chicken that was not cooked with the pasta and is void of seasoning throughout it. This was not the case. The chicken had to be infused and had become one with the flavors of the dish that I wanted to go hug the cook. 

I thought that I had pasta and a calzone before but I was misled in accepting D class pasta as A class. 

If you want to eat at Olive garden again do not come here your taste buds will not accept second rate food again.

Wonderful food!  The pita was soft and warm.  The humus was delicious!  The gyro was huge and exceptionally good. The chicken plate was a cacophony of flavor.  Rice on the bottom, grilled squash next, then topped with seasoned pieces of chicken.  Will definitely go back.

I absolutely love Layla's! It's one of the places I miss most since we moved from the area. Their Greek style pizza is delicious and always has that perfect crust.  The Greek salad with chicken is also great. It's perfectly seasoned and has a generous portion. The prices are incredibly reasonable, especially considering the portions.

One of my favorite places to eat. Each time I have gone I’ve always had a good experience and the food is always delicious. 

I suggest getting one of their quality calzones: I highly recommend either the triple meat, artichoke or Greek calzone with gyro meat!

Layla's is GREAT!!! The lamb is AWESOME!! It's some of the best meat I've ever tasted. It had me singing, "Now behold the lamb, the precious lamb of Layla's." Nice atmosphere. Good service. Definitely one of my go to spots now.

name: Sonny Williams' Steak Room
address: 500 President Clinton Ave Suite 1, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: The best steak & garlic mashed potatoes in Arkansas. This is my most favorite restaurant in the world. No skinny steaks here! The ambiance is amazing, the staff, the food. It's so warm & cozy. I love everything about Sonny Williams!

Had a nice steak dinner for two. Service was good the steaks were seasoned and cooked medium accurately. Green beans and potatoes were okay, had better sides at mom and pop restaurants. 
  Felt like pricing was steep for what we ordered. The highlight was indeed the steak. Decor needs a little touching up.
Jeremy was our waiter this evening and he was attentive, friendly and a great host. The food is divine. The best lobster i have ever had.

This is an expensive steakhouse to be warned. But their steaks, sides, drinks, and atmosphere is unmatched in the river market. Really where to go to have a memorable night or wanting a 1950's mobster feel. The piano man was the absolute icing on the cake. I loved it.

The food was excellent. We shared the porterhouse. It was cooked to perfection. When you split You get a choice of four sides, just a heads up. The service was great. They had TV scattered in certain areas so a great place to go to kill time and watch a game or if you want a nice quiet dinner, they have areas for that too. Great experience. They have valet as well. No complaints.

name: Kemuri
address: 2601 Kavanaugh Blvd, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: Nice atmosphere and excellent food.  Went out with some friends and the food was absolutely fantastic!  Awesome sushi, perfect presentation, and excellent diversity in their menu.  A MUST TRY for everyone who visits or lives in Little Rock!

This is some of the most incredibly flavorful food I have had in a long time. The atmosphere is great and the wait staff is knowledgeable and very friendly. The spare ribs and asparagus were grilled to perfection.

The beef tenderloin is skewered and pairs nicely with a grilled corn on the cob.
Have really enjoyed my experience both times I have been here. Kemuri has a pleasant ambience, excellent service and great food! Attached: The Mango Tango.

My son wanted to celebrate his 19th birthday here and I would like to say that I pride myself on being very versed when it comes to being comfortable in very fancy or posh food situations,but this was the first time I felt so uncomfortable in a restaurant and the server when we asked her questions she basically was no help in suggestions or anything and was very dismissive to our needs. We did end up ordering and it was really good but I will say that we could have gotten food that was just as good that cost alot less somewhere else.

This place is outstanding. The staff was very attentive. Food was very flavorful. Everything was clean, even the top of the picture frames. That's how I check a new restaurant I visit. Go to the bathroom and find a item on the wall. Get a paper towel and wipe across the top. It was cleaned. Very impressed 🙌

name: Maddie's Place
address: 1615 Rebsamen Park Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews:
Rainy, cold day out. Flipped the collar of my jacket up and hunched my shoulders from the parking lot just across the street. Entered through a heavy wooden door into a welcoming, open space with great decorations. It was a quiet afternoon with nothing but the sound of the rain outside and my fellow diners to accompany my meal, which I absolutely ate up. Speaking of, the bowl of roasted chicken and dumpling soup I ordered hit the spot, punctuated with readily-available hot sauce, and complimented by a tall glass of freshly-brewed sweet tea. Baskets of crackers offered some additional texture when desired. The waitress was pleasant and professional.

Overall, a good, cheap, wholesome meal that left me with a full belly and a warm fuzzy feeling as I ventured back out into the elements to continue my day. Only time I've been there so far, but based on my experience I can't recommend it highly enough. Definitely check them out.
Yes, it is that good. If you like good, spicy food full of flavor, you got to check it out! The grilled oysters are to die for!
Chicken tenders were perfect and the 16oz rib eye was.on point. Really enjoyed the thin cut natural fries

Maddie's place is my favorite restaurant in Little Rock. 

I highly recommend the meat pies appetizer and if available, the boudain balls. They are out of this world. 

Food is always consistent and fresh, and service is attentive and quick. 

Maddie's fits the perfect mold of casual dining with exceptional food. Nothing too fancy it's just right.

Amazing Red Fish, great New Orleans oriented menu, with familiar favorites like red beans and rice. Nice surroundings, full bar, helpful staff. Well worth the visit, as I am a returning customer for years!

name: Capital Bar and Grill
address: 111 W Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: One of Little Rock's best kept date night secrets. Great food, knowledgeable bartenders, excellent selection of drinks, GREAT live jazz, cool balcony seating that overlooks part of the city, professional/helpful staff; I could go on and on. The pimento cheese spread and the banana pudding are two of mine and my wifes favorite things. Check it out!
Food is good.  Cocktails are good but overpriced.   The place is small and dark so don't take a big crowd.   It's good for a table of 2 or 3.

This is a quaint bar and grill but the food is not. The chef is the real deal because the food is amazing! I also love their holiday or event-center specialty drinks. When Wicked was playing at the Robinson Auditorium,  they offered some "wicked-good" drinks.

Nice bar in an upscale hotel. Small but nice southern food menu and good cocktail list. Bartenders were friendly and the place had a nice vibe. You can have drinks in the lobby of the hotel and listen to live jazz or sit in the bar area and watch a UFC fight; something for everyone. We ordered a few of the cocktails, the fig and thistle (I think?) was really good. We also ordered the chicken fried steak and pimento grilled cheese with fries and truffle dipping sauce. Both were simple but done well. Good place to stop in if you're downtown.

Wow, the Capital Hotel in downtown Little Rock was a great place to celebrate my wife's accomplishments!
Food totally awesome, atmosphere welcoming with reasonable pricing! 
It was a very special day for us and guess who we met there to make it even more special!

name: The Fold: Botanas & Bar
address: 3501 Old Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: This my absolute favorite taco place.  I am a lover of all things tacos and I will never go to Little Rock and not eat here.  The photos included in this review are just a couple of the MANY times that I have eaten here.  Perfectly priced and WONDERFULLY made and perfectly tasty!  So many flavors that are unique and beautifully paired ingredients.  Drinks have always been top notch and just typing this review makes my mouth water.  I’m ready for more tacos.

New favorite fresh Mexican restaurant in Little Rock.  Parking was tight but once inside you will forget all about that.  Service was great and very helpful.  Fist time visiting and they answered all our menu questions.  The chips and salsa are great with amazing queso so start with that.  Tried 3 dishes and loved each of them. Everything was cooked to order and I was surprised at the end by all the desert options.  Unfortunately I didn’t save room so I’ll just have to go back.  Very fresh and tasty you won’t be disappointed.

Had the 3 taco plate (shrimp, pork and bison), which came with diverse toppings. But the mini crab tacos were ridiculously good!!! Crab meat was so fresh and tasty, including the little salad that comes with it! Can really tell they care about quality here. Easily the best tacos I've had in Little Rock!!  For dessert had the tres leches cake - can't remember the last time I had a cake even comparable in taste and texture. Easily five stars.

I went to the Fold: Botanas & Bar for dinner with some friends after visiting Little Rock Central High School. There was no wait time around 3pm on a Sunday. We ordered the shareable chips and four type dipping sauces—red salsa, green salsa, cheese, guacamole. The chips are delicious and the cheese dipping sauce was the best one out of the four. For the main course, I ordered the 3 taco plate with an additional taco. I ordered two fish tacos, a chicken taco and a beef taco with a side of rice. The food was served in a timely manner. However, the taco meat was not very well seasoned. With a little bit more seasoning, the tacos would be great. The chips and dip was the best part about the meal. I would return to this restaurant just for the chips and dip. The restaurant decor is super cute and it is a relaxing environment. Also, there is an outside patio area that is dog friendly.
Overall good experience got the green salsa appetizer. Ordered Crab sandwich and the three taco plate bison,pork, shrimp. Three of us shared are orders    the meal was good...

name: Table 28
address: 1501 Merrill Dr, Little Rock, AR 72211, USA
reviews: Farm to table at its best.  Located inside the Burgundy Boutique hotel its a must try.  Parking is decent but don’t let that hold you back.  Reservations are welcome but not necessary.  The waitstaff is excellent and they are great at walking you through the menu.  Everything is fresh and they have new items added regularly.  Portions were good size and the flavors of every dish were mind blowing amazing.  My tastebuds were popping out of my brain with delight.

Fantastic! I didn't know what to expect and the place was just great. The waitress was awesome, her recommendations were spot on! The octopus was so tender and delicious, so flavorful! They have oyster tacos, oddly enough, and delicious 😋!
I had the sort rib for the main course and it was very tender and just perfect.
Others had the chicken and donuts (raves), the red snapper also great and a few other dishes.
Can't say enough, definitely go there!

I have had a few trips to Table 28 over the last few years. This was the first time we were seated inside, and it really changed the experience. Server was prompt. Drinks were refreshed frequently, and the food was excellent. We shared two of the fish mains, and both were amazing. Chef came out to say hi after the meal.

This was our third meal, and like the previous, was excellent. The flavors are amazing, everything is well prepared, and the plating is spot on.

What we didn't care for was the new (to us) dining lay out. In the past, the seating was more intimate, almost romantic. Now, it comes across as a hotel restaurant. 

Our server was nice, but she seemed like a minor league player, trying to play in the majors. Maybe she was new, but she definitely needs a proper mentor to be better. With a little refinement, she'll be great.
Very Accommodating Service and the Flavors were wonderful. Words such as exquisite, and elegant come to mind when reflecting my off menu vegan visit. Suggest the mushroom Risotto

name: Soul Fish Café
address: 306 Main St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews:
Best catfish I've had, EVER. And I've eaten a lot of catfish. I thought that I should try something different than what I normally order and ended up trying a special offered on Friday. It had blacked shrimp, fried green tomatoes and fresh greens (the fried green tomatoes are usually served on top of the salad, but I wanted to judge them on their own merit) . It was scrumptious!  I will continue to visit for the catfish but the sides are so tasty.  Hubby's favorite is the black eyed peas, but I love the cabbage and sweet potatoe. 
*Special note: if you have to pay for parking, show your receipt to your server and they will give you a discount.
The fish was well seasoned and cooked well. I ordered my catfish fried extra crispy and it was just perfect to me. Great atmosphere and family vibe. I would definitely return!

I'm on a specific eating plan and Maddie the kitchen manager modified the Ruby Red Trout for me.  She was patient with my requests and was very eager to help me out.  That is HUGE!  My husband loves the blackened catfish and I can not get over how good the trout is.  You won't be disappointed with any of it.  Service, food and atmosphere all combine to make it a dining experience you will want to frequent over and over.

My family loves Soul Fish Cafe! My husband loves that they have whole catfish and he also loves the gumbo. I love pretty much everything on the menu and especially the fried okra and the hushpuppies. My son loves the fried shrimp. We always get seated right away and have always had great service. The only complaint I ever have when I go there is trying to find a parking spot. 😬

Came on a quiet Sunday evening. There were only a few tables occupied, we got seated right away. The restaurant has a modern feel to it, playing light pop music in the background.  Our waitress Kale was very attentive.  We ordered the blackened catfish. It was delicious. Highly recommended overall.

name: Big Orange : Midtown Little Rock
address: 207 N University Ave #100, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: This was our first visit. The wait time yo be seated was really short and the staff were friendly. We ordered two veggie burgers and shakes. They were delicious and we enjoyed it. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I recommend this place to my friends.

First time here. In town for Wicked. Had the Umami Bomb with an Angus Patty. It was pretty good, but I don't know if I'd say one of the best burgers in America. Arkansas maybe, but I've had better burgers in my hometown. Chicken sandwich was good.  Truffle-garlic fries were good.

Atmosphere is fun and friendly and the service was good. Give it a shot and form your own opinion on the burgers.

A story of the great, the bad and the good. The great - Burgers are great, truly amazing, great beef cooked well, great ingredients - lettuce tomato pickle very fresh, amazing. Truffle fries are really good with a garlic aioli sauce that tastes amazing. The bad - The beer pricing is a little outrageous, Lost 40 and the big orange are owned by the same people and somehow trash panda at the big orange is $8.50 when you can buy a four pack at the brewery for $9?? The good - staff are really friendly, atmosphere is amazing, bathrooms are clean. Overall I would recommend ( maybe get a beer somewhere else though ) and I will be back.

By far one of the most pleasant experiences I have had at a restaurant. Waiter was knowledgeable and made fantastic recommendations.  Was honest about whether or not foods were as advertised or left a little to be desired. The burger was by far one of the best I have had and the beer flight is highly recommended.
Nice atmosphere and friendly employees. Our food was brought out quickly and tasted delicious. We got the Border Town Wedge Salad, and the Southern Friend Chicken Sandwich with Sweet Potato Fries.

name: South On Main
address: 1304 S Main St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: Had a party of 20 and the waiters were nothing but nice and patient with the crowd they served. Very professional and great ambience. Perfect date night spot and cozy

Unique menu options with a variety of vegan, gluten free and specialty entrees and appetizers. A small stage and distinctive atmosphere set the stage for great dinners for groups or a date night. Right in the heart of Downtown Little Rock - a must try! The wait staff were very friendly and helpful.

Pork chop with fried sweet potatoes. 👍👍 The chop was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Fried sweet potatoes were the perfect partner to the pork. The restaurant   has a speak easy look & feel. A gem of a restaurant in downtown Little Rock!
Terrific local spot in SOMA.   Fast, friendly service.  Great food and drinks.  Affordable.

Absolutely Love this place, whenever we travel to Little Rock we always swing in for delicious food and vintage atmosphere. The owner is so nice and always has great recommendations and is super personable. Haven't been when there is a show the the stage looks amazing! Honestly would have to work here if I lived in Little Rock AK because I like everything about this place!!!

name: Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken
address: 300 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: The customer service was exceptional!! Our waiter was so friendly and helpful and quick. Food was very good and it was nice & hot when brought out to us. I love potato salad and was told their potato salad was really good, so I tried it. It's made with sweet pickles instead of dill pickles, so kind of made for a weird taste, but it was still good. I'll definitely be going to Gus's again the next time I'm in Little Rock.

We stopped here after a day of hiking. The food was SO delicious! The chicken had just enough spice, and wasn't overly greasy. The fries were the best I've ever tasted! Fries at other restaurants will be incredibly boring after eating these. The staff was friendly, attentive and efficient! Even the owner came over to say "Hi". Prices were reasonable!  We need to find one of these in our home state of Minnesota!  🙂 (P.S. My husband enjoyed the home made pie!)

Chocolate chess pie was over cooked, and crust taste burnt. The chicken was hard and taste like  it was cooked in old peanut oil. I've been there many times but haven't  had an experienced like this one. This was a pick up order.(Disappointed ) On a positive note the lady that brought my food to the car was real nice.

Great spicy fried chicken!!  I ordered a two piece white meat meal with greens and baked beans.  My chicken breast was big in size and the greens were spot on.  The wait staff was courteous,  fast and very friendly!  I definitely recommend this place to everyone.

In my travels from Texas to Illinois I stumbled across a quaint little restaurant named Gus Famous Fried Chicken. I did like most people do and read reviews, some good and some bad. I decided to give it a try and here I am. It happens to be in the downtown area with metered parking. $1.25 for an hour of eating pleasure. Upon entering the restaurant which is cozy I was greeted with a hello and have a seat wherever you would like. My waitress Tia was very prompt and explained the menu choices and answered all my questions. I chose chicken wings, Mac and cheese and potato salad.my meal took 11 minutes to arrive. It was extremely hot and freshly cooked. For dessert I had sweet potato pie. It was excellent. My overall experience was exceptional. I would recommend this restaurant and come back my next trip this way.

name: Whole Hog Cafe
address: 2516 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: THE BURNT ENDS WERE AMAZING. I eat what some might consider an unhealthy amount of barbecue and this place is 100% in my top five ever. The burnt ends, as mentioned, were phenomenal. The ribs were delightful. The pulled pork finished third, but only because one and two were ringers. I also liked the varieties of sauces at each table, six of them to be exact.

Food was great as usual but service was over the top fantastic. They took care of my group of about 25 after a funeral. They did something special that they didn't have to do and had everything set up perfectly when we arrived. They continued to take care of every need to the very end!
The food was really good. The barbeque sauces are all different flavors for every taste. You order and they are really fast with your food. Quiet environment. Good Job guys. Your food is delicious

I love that the meat comes without any sauce and that there is 7 sauce flavors to choose from. Pick 1 sauce or mix n match to make your own sauce. The sliced brisket was perfect by itself but amazing when you add the sauce. Outstanding job!!!
Great food. I really love the sausage. Good serving and service.

name: Trio's Restaurant
address: 8201 Cantrell Rd #100, Little Rock, AR 72227, USA
reviews: Everything was wonderful. Our waitress was great made awesome suggestions that we tried. Food was really good fresh and reasonably priced. Would highly recommend you try this spot.

Great place for brunch and lunch and dinner too. Everything is top notch at this long time favorite of the locals of west Little Rock. Service impeccable and food is delicious. Cannot go wrong with any of the Egg Benedict creations such as the Scandinavian salmon and capers! We were lucky that strawberries were in season in Arkansas and the strawberry short bread cookie crust was luscious. The crab dip is good and is served with crispy French bread. The bread needed more crisp but still very good. Must do bucket list Little Rock eateries!

This is one of our new favorite restaurants. It was our first time. Our server, Krista, gave us great suggestions and was friendly. We had the guacamole, Peck Salad, a sandwich, and the Lorraine Quiche. Everything was so good we tried the key lime pie, which was amazing. You need to try Trio's!

Fantastic service, delicious food, and a quiet atmosphere; perfect place for a date night without the kids, although I did notice they have very reasonably priced kids entrees. I had the Blueberry Pork Tenderloin and my husband had the Voodoo Pasta, both of which were amazing. We'll definitely be returning.

Another place I've been wanting to try today Trio's brought some delicious delicious pasta for all the TSA employees who haven't received their paychecks (two) during this Government shutdown. 

The Officers truly appreciated the generosity that Trio's Restaurant showed. Absolutely generous. 

The catered food was really tasty so I can't wait to go try some other food on their menu.

name: Flying Fish
address: 511 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Grilled salmon, grilled zuchinni, squash and corn was perfectly prepared. Ordering and picking up was extremely easy. We came here all the way from South Texas to help with power restoration after Easter storms. We love to support small businesses! This was a great choice in Little Rock!

Simple and great fried baskets. I tried the catfish and oysters with fries. Although it was a lot of breading for me, i pretty much destroyed the basket. Tartar sauce was great, not sure if they buy or make it. I particularly enjoy restaurants that have stood the test of time, unchanged. Will go back next time I pass through

This will always be one of my absolute favorite places to eat in little Rock. It is always amazing and so delicious every time. I love their grilled shrimp kabobs with grilled squash and zucchini. It is mouthwatering!! They have the best frozen margaritas too. They're soooo good!!

I usually do not leave reviews for restaurants, but this place is TOO AMAZING to not review. I had the grilled salmon salad, it was outstanding. The freshest crisp greens, slices of avocado and tomatoes, slivered almonds, sweetened cranberries; all this topped with a large slab of grilled salmon still dripping garlic butter sauce. Paired with a bowl of phenomenal seafood gumbo, seriously, I can't remember when I have enjoyed a meal so much. It's my first visit to Little Rock, I will be back!

If you like fish, you need to eat here.
If you like Catfish, you have to eat here.
Great pricing, great selection of cooking methods.  Simple place, fairly quick service.  Friendly staff.
Give of a try if you are in the area.  It'll be worth your while.

name: Capeo
address: 425 Main St, North Little Rock, AR 72114, USA
reviews: Didn't have reservations so was seated in a side room. Bit lonely with family when main rooms were packed (kids were misbehaving so maybe lucky). Have to respect any restaurant that daily makes their mozzarella, which was great. Tomato soup felt like they ran out and gave us some extra pizza sauce. Seafood linguine and lobster/prawn pasta were slightly boring, and could have used less salt. Portions decent. Desserts tasty. Service impeccable. Atmosphere charming.

Stopped in to enjoy a lite dinner before the Celtic Women concert. Arrived early as I did not have a reservation. There was NO ONE in the restaurant and I was told there was no tables available. Hopefully my casual attire was not the reason. I give them 2 stars only because the food was very good on my last visit. Customer service has apparently diminished since then.

I had planned on going to a different Italian restaurant, but wanted to make a reservation and the other place didn't take them, so I made them at Capeo for a Thursday night.

All of the people were very polite and engaging. The atmosphere wasn't super quiet, but it wasn't terribly loud. There just happened to be a party nearby that was a bit boisterous. However, it was a good "date" environment. 

The food was really great, and I actually ate all of the food on the plate. Seafood linguine. One thing that they don't have which I feel like an Italian restaurant should have is Angel Hair pasta... OK, it's not really that important, I know. My date liked her meal as well.

I would definitely go back.

I ordered the elk chops, and by far it was THE BEST meat I've ever had in my LIFE. It was perfectly cooked and the texture was soooooo good. The brine they used was perfect and added a great balance of flavor to the elks perfect texture. It had a very red look and then you bite in and it seems to melt in your mouth. The sauce BLEW me away. Also the fried calamari was the best I've had in my life. The flavor was perfectly balanced and fried excellently. The service was excellent and the staff handled our big group very well. Best meal I've had in a long time!
Food was very good.  Service was great!  Shannon is a wonderful server with a sweet smile and very helpful.  She helped choose our Anniversary meal which was just perfect.  Thank you

name: Bonefish Grill
address: 11525 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72212, USA
reviews:
Bonefish Grill is an absolutely wonderful place  to dine, drink, socialize or to have a nice quiet romantic night cap with the most important person in your life. Our waiter, Josh was amazing. As top notch at they come, Josh made sure we were very comfortable, had everything we needed, and thus being our second date he seemed honored to take our picture for us. Totally gets 
5 stars! And Bonefish Grill gets 5 stars as well :)

Delicious!  Jonathan was one of the best servers I've ever had.  I wish I had gotten pictures of more of the food.  I was passing through Little Rock and was taken off of the highway by a long shot, but it was worth it.  Lighting and noise were good for conversation with my wife.  Clean both in the dining area and restrooms.

They have some great fish (which is expected). Especially their wood grilled fish  are very good. Quantity was generous during our first visit but wasn't good the second time with the exact same dish! 
Their rainbow trout is huge while salmon is hit or miss. The sides are pretty good. 
 
They have a big sitting area and it is not noisy like many restaurants. The service is good as well. I would NOT bother ordering any alcohol as that is super expensive and that's where they get you. I would visit again for the fish! 

I would highly recommend buying their gift cards for 20% discount as this restaurant is quite expensive (since it is a chain and they sell too may gift cards).

The Little Rock Bonefish Grill was a great host to our annual family Christmas dinner.  We had 11 adults and 3 children.  We called ahead and made reservations for the group. When we arrived they had the tables put together and menus out on the table.  They brought out children's menus and brought out their food first.  There were 2 wait staff assigned to the table and they kept the drinks coming.  So many restaurants cannot handle groups, but the restaurant did a great job handling the group and being great hosts.  The staff was warm and friendly.  We will definitely consider going here again!

We have always had great experiences here! We went the say before Valentine's day and it was really busy but we were seated within 15 minutes despite not having a reservation. I think our waitress's name was Michelle and she was helpful and nice. (The staff are always superb.) I can be indecisive so she helped us pick drinks and dessert. The bang bang shrimp were an awesome appetizer and are $6 on Wednesday! We splurged and got the guacamole with shrimp as well. We each got the sirloin and crab cake dinner and our steaks were cooked perfectly (medium rare). The portions are good without being over the top and I always leave with at least 1 to go box. The chocolate melting cake with berries for dessert was perfect for sharing.

name: Cache Restaurant
address: 425 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews:
You'll love the ambiance and food variations. This place is design for people to relax and enjoy a nice evening for sure. The patio has a nice view plus fire pits. 

It will he hard to leave there hungry! It's also a good business spot to entertain clients.

I probably should have given it a five.  My wife dish was very tasty and the shrimp were cooked just right.  My dish was too salty and they were very gracious in remaking it. Too bad you can't give half points... I took video and pictures and bragged to on FB and Instagram.  We may make this place an every other week visit. The ambience was great!!!
Yuuuuuuummmmmmy food great atmosphere modern yet elegant and up stairs they have a bar lounge. Out on the balcony you can get a good view as well. Staff very professional.
Great food and atmosphere. Pricey- 14 dollars for bacon shown below but it was delicious. The sides are priced well for the portions.

Food doesn't get much better than here. Seabass was so fresh, rigatoni rich in flavor and risotto so creamy (added 3 scallops - cooked beatifully). Great location and service absolutely impeccable!! We had creme brulee and cheesecake for dessert, which were amazing. Easy to spend a lot of money on food and alcohol here, so be careful...but its worth it!!

name: Arthur's Prime Steakhouse
address: 16100 Chenal Pkwy, Little Rock, AR 72223, USA
reviews: Nice restaurant! Would have received 5 stars if not for the following. Tables are a little too close for comfort. Steak was under cooked and brussel sprouts were a bit mushy. We expect more attention to detail for the price paid.

Arthur's is wonderful! It is expensive, but you get what you pay for. Service, atmosphere and the food are all great. I don't think you can go wrong with anything off of the menu. I definitely enjoyed celebrating our anniversary there and they made it extra special with the dessert. The creme brulee is awesome and I will go back just to get that. Arthur's is a must!

Wow! This place is totally amazing. Our waiter was super attentive and helpful.  Our food was very delicious. We are celebrating our 17 year anniversary and they gave us a complimentary customized dessert to mark this very special occasion.  Our food was cooked to perfection. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Excellent service! Food is wonderful and owner is in dining area to check on his guests. It is a little pricey, so worth it for a special occasion. Also, love the sparkling light fixtures. A+ Atmosphere.

Prime steak restaurant with great service.  The steaks were delicious and cooked to perfection.  Creamed spinach was creamy and delicious and the scalloped potatoes were top notch.  We ordered some bottles of wine as well and the selection was top tier.  Price was as expected, $$$$, but the food and service matched the price.  If in Little Rock and are looking for a steak dinner where price isnt a factor, this is the place to go.

name: Ciao Baci
address: 605 Beechwood St #3846, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: Man I've had some great meals here before but when I was here a couple weeks ago it was a big disappointment. This is a favorite spot in Little Rock especially when I wanna eat something kinda late at night. I still think about the fried rabbit I had a couple years ago. I had the steamed mussels and they were not fresh.  A couple were not even open. I had some in Bethesda the following week and they were like night and day.  The ones I get at home in New Orleans are fresh also. I know my seafood.  I understand Little Rock is more inland but if you can't keep fresh live seafood then it shouldn't be on the menu.  But I've had fresh mussels at other places in Little Rock.  I'm glad I didn't get sick. I gave three stars because my waitress was extremely nice and all the meals I've had here before were good. My waitress was so nice I still left a 20% tip for the original total.  But that was my first and last time having their steamed mussels.

This place was pretty dope. From my understanding, they have seasonal menus, use nice ingredients, and rotate stuff frequently. This was my first time here but the duck confit I got was phenomenal. The drinks were also really awesome, no Ramos gin fizz though. Maybe next time. The staff was super nice and attentive. Would definitely recommend and will definitely be going back soon.

The best resturant I have been to in a very long time. The atmosphere was perfect, romantic, and quaint. The food was unique, very flavorful, and just really very good. The staff were awsome, and made us feel like we had been there 100 times before. Would highly recommend!

Bartender is the reason for the 4 star rating and not 2 or 3 star. 

Ordered calamari that was under seasoned and served with cocktail sauce + mariana. 3/5

Cocktails were 5/5 hands down. 

Elderflower is in 75% - 85% of their cocktails. 

Great atmosphere and service. 

Totally coming back

Love this restaurant. Service is fabulous.  Food is superb!  Highly recommend the BBQ pork rinds with the spicy maple mayo and the jalapeno cheddar tots, the duck confit was superb and my husband really enjoyed the lamb shank

name: Istanbul Mediterranean Restaurant
address: 11525 Cantrell Rd #914, Little Rock, AR 72212, USA
reviews: It was our second visit and it was just as amazing as our first. The food is freshly prepared and arrives hot and full of flavor. I'm not a huge fan of hummus but theirs is delicious beyond words. I had the beef and lamb plate. My wife had the chicken gyro. Everything was just amazing. My wife said later in the day we've got to go back. The grilled vegetables we're perfect! Will definitely go back

Delicious food and friendly folks! I was traveling through Little Rock and happened to drive by this place and stop in for lunch. I grew up with Greek food and this place does not disappoint with their Mediterranean vibes. The Turkish coffee was delicious, as was the salmon platter and house made rice pudding!
Superb food. Excellent meat quality. We really enjoyed it and can't wait to come back. The staff is very helpful and gave us very good service.

Istanbul is incredible. The food is so delicious and the people that own/run it are so kind. One of our favorite places in Central AR.

The Beef/Lamb Donner is hard to beat. Their hummus is so smooth and the flavor lacks that sharp finish many others have. Add a Turkish coffee and Profiteroles for a heavenly conclusion.

So I’ve never had this type of food before and I cook a lot. I was very impressed with everything. Seasoned to perfection, the service was on point. Prices are very reasonable. I am definitely going back often and recommending this place to everyone.

name: Red Door
address: 3701 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: There was about a 30 minute wait and it was so extremely worth it. Pricing is very reasonable for such good food. Our waitress, Brittany, was extremely helpful on recommendations. Our food came out fast and hot. Any place that makes homemade biscuits and croissants, plus melting cheese over food needs 5 stars at all times.

Not bad.  Not bad at all.  I had the bbq shrimp and stone grits with a side of sauteed spinach.  The staff was friendly and we were promptly seated on a Tuesday at 600 pm with hardly anyone in the restaurant. The restaurant is clean and the parking was easy.  I will be back.
Went for breakfast with my husband,  very pleased. The Eggs Benedict with crab cake was outstanding! Everything was delicious. We will definitely return.

I went there twice and both times it was only average. I got a very salty crab cake, in which I got middle of my entree.
Second time we got steaks, where we ordered it medium rare, came out medium well.
For a "high end" restuarant it doesn't even have big solid ice.
Wouldn't go again, or recommend to anyone

My cousin recommended this place for breakfast, and it was so good! My mom got one of the skillets, and I ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs. We were both very impressed with the food. The service was great. We sat outside on the patio because the weather was so nice. I would definitely come back the next time I'm in town!

name: The Butcher Shop
address: 10825 Hermitage Rd, Little Rock, AR 72211, USA
reviews: If you love delicious thick- cut steaks, the Butcher Shop should definitely be on your must-visit list of Little Rock restaurants. Their beef always comes out properly prepared and you won't wait too long between ordering and eating. The service is absolutely wonderful. This is the perfect place for dinner when you want to treat family, friends or business acquaintances. Highly recommend.

Been in Little Rock THREE years and haven't had service like this yet. By FAR the best. Good job guys!! Coming from someone who owns their own catering business and I've been a restaurant manager for years, excellent service. Hats off to you guys!!!
The place looks really nice, the service was wonderful and the food was delicious!!! Totally worth it. Definitely will be back again. I totally recommend it.
Awesome experience.   Great atmosphere, excellent variety of food choices.  My meal was excellent.  I would highly recommend to family and friends.
Incredible steaks and Alfredo sauce along with award winning homemade gourmet cheesecakes. Super friendly servers and bartenders

name: Capers Restaurant
address: 14502 Cantrell Rd #4271, Little Rock, AR 72223, USA
reviews: Amazing food, service and atmosphere. We had a great time. The small group nooks are perfect.

Their outdoor sitting area is beautiful. The food is good and worth trying at least once. The waiters are very courteous. 

Not all food items are good. This restaurant is on the expensive side for lunch, especially because the food quantity per dish is not much. Overall a good restaurant though!

Shrimp cocktail appetizer, grilled Mahi Mahi w/mango salsa, soft shell crab, chilled shrimp, veggies & cheddar cheese grits. Amazing meal, service was excellent. Great birthday dinner!!! Will definitely go back again.
My porkchop was dry and tough. My mother's mahi mahi was very dry. Our waiter was high or drunk. The creme brulee was delicious.

Great food, waiters and ambiance!
Nice separate room for special events.
Convenient location.

name: Loca Luna
address: 3519 Old Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: This was our first visit to Loca Luna. We started off at the Red Door but the wait was crazy long so we walked next door.  I'm so glad we did! My husband had the chicken fried chicken and I had the Spanish casserole. There foods was delicious and the service great! The charro beans needed a little salt, but otherwise wonderful. The roasted potatoes were melt in your mouth deliciousness. We'll definitely be back to try more menu items.

The service was great. We were seated right away, and the staff was very friendly. The food came fresh, and very tasty. It's a great place for brunch on Saturday morning. My wife and I will come back and try some of their other menu items. Well worth the money.

Crab cake eggs Benedict for brunch was awesome! The hostess the waiter and the waitress were all very engaging and very on top of everything. This was my first visit here but will definitely be going back. A good friend informed me that dinner is just as good as the breakfast.

Stuffed grouper was great, the crab toppings were delicious! Kids pasta had a tasty marinara sauce. Loved the capers in both dishes and how paper was the table cloth, really entertaining for kids to draw. Hostess was fantastic at seating us and bringing color pencils. Do have to say pepperoni pizza was flaccid and way too salty. However, after living in LR for a year now, seems like this is pretty standard for pizza here. Good service and atmosphere.

Everything about this place was absolutely fabulous I had the best time from the atmosphere the food the drinks the service our waitress was amazing everything was perfect I will come back over and over again!!!!

name: Cafe Bossa Nova
address: 2701 Kavanaugh Blvd #105, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: The ambiance was one of a kind. the menu was inspiring to the effect of wanting to order everything in this one meal.  Our waitress not only showed a unique passion for each dish, she gave us a greater understanding of the dish itself. Our experience was on Valentine's day and the special chocolate truffles were exquisite. We will be coming back. I can't wait too!

I've been wanting to try this place forever but just haven't. The staff was wonderful, the food was good but expensive.

I highly recommend the Xingu beer and the Brasileirissimo Streak - very tasty!

Edit:  I decided to try the Sunday brunch, it was pretty good, but not spectacular (I'm a tough breakfast critic). I had the biscuits with gravy and 2 eggs.  The gravy was not your normal country sausage gravy, the sausage was unique and the result was pretty darned good if a little salty. The biscuits were good, but I found it odd that they toasted them (usually not a sign of home made). The eggs kind of missed the mark - a perfect over medium well egg will have a yoke that is like jelly and no brown skin on whites (I did mention I'm picky about breakfast, right). The eggs missed on both of these marks (brown skin and runny yoke).

Good food. Good service. Very nice place to get together. Dress is casual, but meal seem like it is from a more formal restaurant. We arrived later on Thursday and caught the end of some live music. Very nice. We were told by the singer that there is live music every Thursday.
The Tuesday special was delicious!  Shrimp in a curry sauce on top of rice with sauteed vegetables.

This food is truly something different than the other local restaurants. I don’t have any experience with Brazilian food, but love the food here. I will say that they do move at a slower pace here, so maybe not the best place for a quick meal.

name: Raduno | Brick Oven & Barroom
address: 1318 S Main St, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: This is a really cool place. The atmosphere is nice. The food is amazing. I ordered an apple cider type beer that was very good. It was a nice change from what I normally drink. My girlfriend and I had the cheese appetizer. It was very good. My only complaint about it is I wish there was more different types of cheeses. It had several other little finger foods which made it good though. For the main course I had the Italian sub and my girlfriend had the chicken alfredo. My sandwich came with the soup of the day which was a sausage and potato soup. Everything was so good. I will definitely be returning.

Came here for their well regarded Sunday brunch.

Lox pizza was 4/5 and gluten free pizza was a 2/5. Only issue is the gluten free crust, which was very small and hard. The topings were a hit though. 

Good place for parties of 2 or 4. Amazing huge bar and very nice modern vibe otherwise.

Went there for lunch with a friend. I recommended it because of reviews.  Nice atmosphere.  We were not pressed for time, but did need to get back to a meeting. We asked our waiter how long it may take for a pizza because it looked so good at a nearby table.  She responded rudely that we should expect to wait a bit. She said that we were not the only ones there. I asked if there were smaller pizza options. She stared at us. We opted for a sandwich and a salad. As we waited SEVERAL others were seated around us and began being served...........PIZZA. Quickly.  Apparently, there was some type of lunch special that included......PIZZA.  Funny how our wait person NEVER mentioned it or suggested it.   I ate a $17 sandwich (Italian beef... not great, but good) My friend tried to eat her $12 salad that was drenched so heavy with dressing she was only able to eat the top.  Neighboring tables had pizza. We drank an entire bottle of water with no refill which we would have gladly paid for. Our wait person only returned once....with our tickets. When we left, all three wait staff and hostess were at the bar deep in conversation.  Won’t be back. Our time (and money) were not valued. We had choices and chose here. We will opt other choices in the future

This was our second visit to Raduno. In both cases, the service was attentive without being smothering, and the servers were knowledgeable about the menu.

The antipasto board included a nice variation of many ingredients, while the burrata was creamy and delicious. 

The pizzas were flavorful, properly dressed, and fired expertly. They were crispy, and held the ingredients expertly. 

If you are looking for good pizza in Little Rock, look no further.

I like this place.  True to it's name, you can get a decent pizza and a cold brew.  The crowd is mixed.  They have an excellent bar which runs most of the depth of the space.  The waitresses and barkeeps are friendly and provide excellent service.  The beers and the food I've had here have been very good.  The atmosphere is laid back and relaxed.  Highly recommend.  Taking a star off because most of the beer selections are IPAs which is the fad now.

name: Izzy's
address: 5601 Ranch Dr #4496, Little Rock, AR 72223, USA
reviews: Always delicious food. Make sure to save room for dessert! Bread pudding, lemon ice box, and raspberry cream. The staff is always friendly and wonderful.

My husband and I had dinner here over the weekend. He's a somewhat regular, but I haven't been in quite some time. He ordered their beef tamales with cheese dip which he always enjoyed. I ordered the chicken tortilla soup which is a meal in itself that comes with fresh avocado. Everyone working seemed to be a teen but had impeccable manners, was pleasant, and always smiling. My glass was never empty and they stuck my dessert with ice cream in the freezer until we checked out. We will continue to return.

Izzy's was phenomenal. There was a lot to choose from and everything sounded yummy. There were a lot of choices for gluten free folk. I ordered chicken salad and a fruit salad with yogurt poppy dressing. Delicious! Others at my table ordered pizza, side salads, tamales, chicken tortilla soup, and bread pudding for dessert. It all looked great and tasted even better. Izzy's is a must if you are ever in Little Rock.
A Little Rock original gem. The menu is diverse with a little bit of something for everyone. The food is delicious, and the wait staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Family-owned and operated. Clean, attractive, friendly. THE BEST veggie-burger. Everything fresh. Nice selection of teas. Great service. Lovely colorful art by local artists. Worth enduring Cantrell traffic.

name: Tokyo House
address: 11 Shackleford Dr, Little Rock, AR 72211, USA
reviews: The selection was very small compared to other buffets. I could not taste the difference between the run of the mill Chinese food buffet and this location. Honestly, as a traveler this place is a good place, but not my choice dining for the future. It has a 4.5 stars rating, but I do not know why. The best that I can do and only because they had fried frog legs and it's a buffet; is a 3 rating -Too high of a price per person for a small selection.

Best bang for buck for Asian food around! Who would've thought Little Rock had an amazing Asian buffet? Delicious dishes of Chinese, Japanese and Korean. The sushi and sashimi is freshly made. I definitely will drive out of my way to visit this place when I'm in Little Rock. I highly recommend this place.

Love this place, and although I'm not sure if most of it is genuine Japanese food, they have dishes on and off the sushi menu that you can't really find anywhere else in town, especially at a buffet. The food is impressive, the spread is kind of fancy. They have a full and fresh sushi bar with sashimi, and baby octopus and jellyfish salads. The price gets knocked up about $5 on weekends but they typically have different dishes. I recommend to anyone wanting some good Japanese food.

I love this place for lunch- plus it's more affordable. The one time I went for dinner the buffet choices were different and they didn't have my favorite beef dish ( I think it's called kobe beef).  The sushi is amazing. The have "starter" sushi for folks like me who enjoy California rolls, but hubby and the kiddo are far more adventurous.  The sushi is made right there and all the ingredients are very fresh.  They even have a fruit sushi roll.

My wife and I went with friends. They have a nice lunch buffet.
This was one of our favorite places to eat in West Little Rock
They had plenty of choices including shrimp and fish and if you like sushi try this place. I believe the cost was $12.95.
We go at least twice a year. 
We live in the Village so we don't always go to Little Rock for dinner.

name: MeMe’s Twisted Potato
address: 3005 Asher Ave, Little Rock, AR 72204, USA
reviews:
What A GREAT dining experience! The atmosphere is eclectic and a little funky. The service is entertaining and efficient but most of all, the food is exceptional. Vegan takes on comfort food and various ethnic foods. 
One thing. This is NOT a fast food restaurant. It takes up to 45 minutes to be served. It is worth the wait!

Hearty, delicious vegan food! Don’t judge this book by its cover - we almost drove on after laying eyes on the haunted-looking house in the middle of a cemetery, but are so glad we didn’t! The buffalo cauliflower, kale salad, and fried green tomato sandwich were particular highlights of an enormous meal bursting with flavors. MeMe was incredibly sweet and warm, and made us feel like guests for a home-cooked meal. An essential stop for vegans and veg-curious diners in Little Rock!

If you are in the area I highly recommend going to MeMe’s, we had just gotten to town after a long drive 15 minutes before close. She accommodated us and cooked the most delicious cauliflower wings I’ve ever had. The kale salad was amazing as well. Huge portions, great food!

Go eat here as soon as possible. Schedule a little extra time (about 45min), because your food is being hand-made for you. You aren't at a fast food restaurant, you are getting the opportunity to be fed by someone who is preparing some of the most flavorful food you may have ever eaten. Don't have time to wait? Call ahead a plan for pickup. Enjoy!

The food was amazing! We ordered online and and got the emails giving us updates on our order throughout the process. The website clearly states that this is not fast food so be patient! We ordered 4 different dishes and each was cooked perfectly! Will be back for sure!

name: Buenos Aires Grill & Cafe
address: 614 President Clinton Ave a, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: I really liked it.  The atmosphere was really nice.  I actually noticed the flowers on the table were real and fresh.  The staff was very nice and friendly.  The food was delicious and full of flavor.  The skirt steak was moist and had a grill flavor that was out of this world.  Everything was perfect.  I highly recommend this for a dinner spot.

My husband and I have been wanting to go here for a long time, we finally stopped by and it was 200% worth it. We had a three piece empanada, 1 chicken, 1 beef, 1 ham & cheese. All were good but chicken was the best. Shared a Buenos Aires mixed grill that comes with chicken, flank & skirt steak, shrimp & bratwurst. A margarita & beer. Everything was exceptional and we were planning our next visit while eating appetizers. The margarita was very weak, I'll stick to beer going forward.

This is one of our go to date night spots! The food is amazing, the atmosphere is awesome, and the service is exceptional! They catered our iRealty Arkansas Christmas party this year and everybody raved about how good the food was. Love love love this place!

I was so excited to try this place. The service was slow and it took an hour to get our entrees. And then they were cold! The manager (owner?) apologized for the delay and offered a 20% discount but it was still pricey. We paid $85 (with tip) for 2 entrees, 1 kids meal, 2 apps and 2 drinks. I wouldn't have a problem if the food and service were on point.

Excellent service! excellent food and location. Owners are so welcoming and accommodating. Quality of food is amazing and prices are excellent!!! Definitely a place to visit every time in Little Rock, AR

name: Little Greek Fresh Grill
address: 11525 Cantrell Rd #905, Little Rock, AR 72212, USA
reviews: I love little Greek and everyone who works there. Especially my girl, Cheryl. She always takes such good care of me. I have been going to little Greek once a week for about five years now and they consistently crank out amazing food! It’s a little more expensive but it’s worth it for the high quality cuisine and awesome service! Love you guys!!!

Great Mediterranean food! Fast & friendly service, tv’s with sports & news around the eating area, plenty of table or booth seating. Order your food and pay at the counter, take a number and they bring it to you. Greek salad with lamb was 👍🏽.

Very good.  I love the cannoli.  I've never had the dolmades due to not being open minded with leaves.  I tried it with my wife and I have to admit...  They were very delicious and probably the best thing I've eaten in a while.  Five thumbs up.

This was my first time but won’t be my last! I ordered the Gyro platter and my wife and daughter ordered the chicken kabob dinner. We all loved the food. But, the star that stole the show was the fried pita chips with the hummus. The chips were the best I’ve ever eaten! Crispy on the outside soft in the center and absolutely awesome! We will be back! I can highly recommend this clean and inviting restaurant to you!
Omg, I had the chicken pita. The bread was so warm & fresh. I wanted to wrap myself in it like a blanket. Will definitely be back soon.

name: Copper Grill
address: 300 E 3rd St # 101, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews:
This place is a hidden gem. The atmosphere is very nice. The drinks are good and I only had the appetizer sampler but it was served its purpose. The millionaire bacon.. 🤤 lol
Also, the coconut cream pie was creamy and delicious.

Copper Grill is my favorite restaurant in Little Rock!! Not only is the food excellent (never had a dish I didn’t love!) with an atmosphere that is elegant yet very comfortable and obvious it’s frequented by neighborhood locals!! The staff and owners are super and wait staff make you feel as though you are friends! Love this downtown restaurant!! 5 stars!
Excellent customer service, great food!  Lee is an exceptional server, the  Vibe is super chill. Great place to go for drinks or food
Really great spot for a business lunch or date night. Love the Signature Sweet Hot Burger and the Sampler Platter. Great patio for Happy Hour.

We had a wonderful evening at Copper Grill!  Had a one night stay in LR and Copper Grill was just around the corner from our hotel.    Our waiter, Richard, was perfectly attentive - kept the wine poured and courses perfectly spaced.  Don’t miss the oyster appetizer, stuffed chicken or spicy meatloaf.....all delicious!   We will definitely return the next time we pass through the area.

name: Three Fold Noodles + Dumpling Co.
address: 611 S Main St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Great food. I like there chicken noodle. Definitely check out this place when you want to eat something downtown Little Rock.

This place has become my new favorite. I have eaten here several times over the last few weeks and it has been great every single time! This is a great place to pick up at. You can easily order online and just pick up in 20-30 minutes! Yum yum yum.

Delicious food, fast service, and friendly staff.  The menu is very simple yet jam packed with flavor.  I had the Half and Half dumpling and noodle bowl with chicken and medium heat on my first trip. The bowl was filling and appropriately priced.  Great atmosphere with a modern vintage vibe.  I will absolutely return.

Awesome Food very very fresh my boyfriend and I absolutely loved it. The chef was very nice and attentive. The guy that took our order was very polite. I advise one thing though from the other guy at the register.  Don't know if this guy owned the place or what but we can tell he either judged us for who we are or he was having a bad day. This was our very first time eating here and I looked online prior to coming to the restaurant so I asked for  the two fold noodle bowl. So he was being arrogant and stated that is the name of the restaurant but if you look at your menu you have a salad named  the two fold salad right under the noodle bowl. I will not let his attitude affect my experience. Very Very Good fresh food minus the attitude. I totally recommend!!!!

My sandwich was so salty that I could not eat it.  I also had the pork dumplings and they we good but nothing to make a special trip for.  People were not as friendly one would like.  The atmosphere was good.

name: So Restaurant Bar
address: 3610 Kavanaugh Blvd, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: Wow!  I loved So Restaurant. The food and service we're amazing. Our waiter was on point and very friendly and knowledgeable. The wine list was very extensive and had a great selections to choose from. I loved our food and appetizer. I definitely recommend this place and I'm definitely coming back. Thank you very much. What a classy little place.

In May we had a company function here with around thirty people and the food and service were excellent. The atmosphere was nice in the back upstairs group room. Very accommodating area for a large group. The servers worked very hard with all the food and drink orders. The desert were delicious and we cannot day enough good things about this service oriented restaurant!

As someone who is both a regular customer and a former employee here, I can confidently say that Sõ offers one of the greatest dining experiences in Arkansas. The cooks are all exceptional at creating phenomenal dishes, and the head chef continues to top himself with a creative special each week, while the front house staff are attentive and consistently on point. If you're looking for top notch food and service at a reasonable price, Sõ is where to go.

I typically would not post this type of review for the public to see. I contacted the restaurant in private, saw that they read my note and 48 hours later, still no response. So, here is the note I sent to SO Restaurant. “I visited your restaurant for the very first time last night, NYE. It’s a beautiful facility, charming and elegant. Our waiter was Brock. We had a 5:30 reservation for 6. We were seated promptly. We all ordered from the NYE limited menu. 5 of us got the oysters as our appetizer. The oysters were room temperature. It was an item that should be hot, melting cheese from being under the broiler. The oysters in the Bienville were very strong, fishy tasting/smelling. Very disappointing dish all around the table. The Turtle soup was ordered by most of us for the next course. It had good flavor, but has also room temp, not even warm. Again, very disappointing. Most of us ordered the prime rib for our main course. The mashed potatoes were divine, as was the asparagus with shaved yams. Delicious. The seasoning on the prime rib was excellent. The prime rib however, was also not warm, and mine was very, very tough. Difficult to cut. Just a terrible cut of meat. The desserts were hit and miss. Pineapple cake was great. The cheese plate was cold brie and a glob of apricot jelly. Just terrible. Never had cold brie cheese.  The chocolate truffles were awful, dense, dry, hard, just awful. We ordered coffee and it took 3 times reminding Brock for us to get it, one in a dirty cup, and not hot. It was bad. It took 3 times asking Brock in order to get a glass of tea. Brock was frazzled, kind of high strung, odd. I wanted to inform you of our experience and I would never want to put this on public social media. We are all professional people and we eat at fine dining establishments often. Our tickets had a 20% tip automatically added in. I thought that was tacky. I felt this may have been the single most overpriced meal I have ever had then was forced to pay 20% for mediocre service from our waiter. I feel terrible even writing all this, but the owner of this establishment deserves to know this.”
Nice, quiet sophisticated spot! Pork chops with the ghost pepper glaze, off the chain. Will definitely be back!!

name: La Hacienda Mexican Restaurant
address: 3024 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews: La Hacienda is a Little Rock Classic. A well established local restaurant that was recently remodel. You can expect fast service and delicious food. They have a tasty salsa that is more flavorful than spicy. That have a large food and drink menu with all American-Mexican classics all at a decent price. Don't forget to grab a lime mint on your way out!

great food and staff. place was clean. my only issue with this place was how often people were coming by to ask if everything was ok or if we needed anything. its good you care about your customers just give them a little breathing room to enjoy there meal. if there drink is getting low simply just bring them another one you don't need to ask every time you see a glass half full.
Service was great.  Good food.  The restaurant looked very clean and neat. Loved the wood designs on the tables. I'll visit again.

My husband and I were looking for really good salsa. We saw the reviews for this restaurant on Google and decided to try it. We have driven past this for years but never stopped. We were not disappointed! Salsa and the green salsa was excellent! I had the Ala Diable chicken. The meat was well done and had tons of flavor. The refried beans were great! My husband had the street tacos and he really enjoyed. We will be coming back as our “go to” for Mexican food!
Good consistent Mexican food. Their new menu is really nice.. you can tell they spent some money on it.

name: The Pantry Crest
address: 722 N Palm St, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: I have been here on several occasions and am always delighted. The staff is pleasant. I love the vibe of the restaurant. It's in a converted house. There is plenty of seating and I beleive that when the weather is nice they have outdoor seating as well. There are dedicated handicap spaces in front of restaurant but the rest is street parking or in a nearby grocery store lot. My friend and I went last night as we heard that there was a late night happy hour from 10pm to 12am. Most of the appetizers are half price (shrimp is not). Everything is beautifully presented and the food is always delicious! Can't wait to be back.
