Warm, cozy environment envelops you to a place away from it all. Being a hummus junkie, it did lack a little flavor🤔, but every other dish tried was highly flavorful. They serve traditional drinks but also have delicious, unique cocktails if you're up for trying something new.

The food was top notch -
quality ingredients and tasty central European dishes. The Hungarian sausage with the egg noodles and vegetable medley was prefect. I’ll return here the next time visit Little Rock.

First time to try this restaurant and I will say it didn't let us down. The beef stroganoff was off-the-wall great, as was the breaded Jager schnitzel!! Share the dessert-Chocolate Salami- rich & delicious.

One of my favorite restaurants in the area.  Always excellent service and we really enjoy the drinks.  In particular love that the kitchen stays open pretty late.  I go here regularly and have no reason to stop.  My favorite place in the neighborhood and one of my favorites in the city.

name: Doe's Eat Place
address: 1023 W Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Does is a staple in little rock for many reasons. Steak,tamales,shrimp, and a killer atmosphere ! You never know what celebrity of Arkansas may frequent this place. The wait staff is awesome and the food is just as good! Never dissatisfied when we head over there!

I have heard a lot about Doe's over the years and FINALLY I had a chance to try it. The food is not bad but I've had better seasoned steak. We ordered the 4lb sirloin and split it among the 4 of us. Its a unique atmosphere but sadly not worth the hype for me. However, if you go please do try the homemade chocolate cake!

Small unsuspecting spot for steak family style. Order your steak type (or shrimp) and it comes with sides for the table family style. Steak was good and homemade fries were too; not sure we needed the red potatoes AND fries but that’s how it comes. Friendly staff.

Some of the best, juiciest steak in Little Rock, served in a unique family style. Doe's has always impressed and they remain a landmark location downtown. If you want the porterhouse though, be sure to reserve one ahead of time!

Was told I had to go and try the porterhouse and went an did that for my birthday. Very nice dinner, and a small little hole in the wall kind of restaurant, but was delicious and well worth the money.

name: Cathead's Diner
address: 515 Shall Ave, Little Rock, AR 72202, USA
reviews:
Ok... “All you can eat brunch” and they have cocktails & Mimosas. I mean really, when was the last time you went to a cafeteria style, family friendly buffet and had a Bloody Mary? Well, it was a first for me.

Open dining hall in the newly renovated “paint factory”. Very friendly and accommodating staff. The menu changes on a regular basis. The offerings today included pulled pork, chicken tenders and greens to go along with the usual breakfast options.
And of course they had awesome biscuits with your choice of white or “chocolate” gravy.

Everything was very good, but they do have an opportunity to improve their freshly prepared eggs. I suggest perhaps a separate “station” or table. I ordered eggs over easy (willing to wait for them), but our waitress brought them to the table and they were over cooked.

Oh yeah, they have biscuits as big as a “Cat’s Head”. 😉👍

Great southern food perfect for a brunch outing. Ambiance was loud, but that’s as to be expected for a Sunday. My husband and I are both in the hospitality industry and understand how hectic it can be to work on a busy day. However, as this was our first time coming to dine we would have loved an explanation from our server on the process, instead she said something along the lines of,  “go on up”. Would have loved to give it 5 stars, but the service was lacking.
Tasty, Hot, ready and fresh home cooking served buffet style with many pie options to choose from. Wear loose fitting clothing for comfort!!!
Fulfilling. If you're working and you want to eat lunch here...You will need a nap. I had the meatloaf, greens Mac & cheese, mash potatoes and corn bread. I was way too full, but you'll love it.

Food was amazing and very super surprising! I am a big critic when it comes to soul food especially greens! Most of the downtown area does not have good greens but this place had some good greens and they seasoned it so well. And oh my gosh let’s not get started on the tator casserole!! To die for! I’m a big dessert person and their peach cobbler and bread pudding was the bomb! What also made this place great was the service and the owner. Being an owner myself to a few restaurants, I understand the importance of being present and infront of the restaurant. Makes people feel good and happy they are talking to the chef!

name: The Terrace - Mediterreanean Kitchen
address: 2200 N Rodney Parham Rd #120, Little Rock, AR 72212, USA
reviews: Love the trio hummus and every meal my husband and I have had has been wonderful!! Great staff and food!
An excellent long time restaurant here in Little Rock. Authentic and flavorful food served in a beautiful, small spot. You will love this place.
Pretty hard to find and you definitely want a reservation but the food and service were absolutely incredible. The Babaganouj is especially delicious
Absolutely the best restaurant in Little Rock!  The food and service are consistently great. I’ve eaten all over the world, and The Terrace ranks with the best. Every dish is outstanding.
The food is always good here. I usually order the salmon or chicken dish with great results. Atmosphere is cozy. Service is hit or miss.

name: Ciao | Italian Restaurant
address: 405 W 7th St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Had a great dinner the other night.  Their lobster ravioli was delicious.  Always love their cream of mushroom soup and the mushrooms ravioli too.  Great steak and pastas.  Friendly service, nice atmosphere, and Becky always makes us feel welcome.  Highly recommend!

I was in Little Rock for the Marathon weekend ( Mar 2020) and needed some pasta. I went for dinner and order the Bolognese pasta. The  pasta was a little under cooked , but the sauce was very good. The service was great and very friendly, but at the end it took forever to get the check. And took forever to my credit Card back, due to the restaurant only have one credit card machine working.
Me and my wife love our dinner experience everytime we eat here. It is our go to for a speacial occasion date night!

Visiting from Dallas and this place is close to the historical sites. We had a party of five for lunch. We all really enjoyed the food and loved the waitress. There was something for everyone on the menu and the prices were very reasonable.
Was in town for Little Rock marathon and they had special dishes so you could Carbo load. How great is that! Nice place, good variety, great food, fair prices

name: At The Corner
address: 201 E Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: As always we had an another unbelievably good brunch experience at The Corner.  The food is unique and always delicious, the service and speed is impeccable, and we've literally never had anything other than a perfect experience here.  The most intimidating part about it is that there is usually a wait line outside and yet even that moves so quickly because of how well run it is.  Cannot recommend this place enough

I would have given 5 stars but my biscuit was room temperature and the sausage gravy was barely warm. I ordered the biscuit & gravy breakfast. Everything tasted pretty good, just the food could have been (heat) hotter. The staff was pleasant. The atmosphere of the restaurant was cozy. We will go back for another try.

Great locally family owned restaurant. I've heard about it from friends from France as well as Little Rock foodies. The restaurant is able to accompany a surprisingly large number of people. If you want a Sunday brunch, get there early as the line was about  a quarter way down the block. Metered Parking only, is not free during the week, but it is on the weekends. An ever changing menu based on locally sourced products and seasonal food make each experience unique and varied. Delicious. Great for casual dining.

A-MAAAAAZING!! My family and I were driving back home to Oregon and read a review, so we stopped on our way through. Our children have never had food so delicious!! Seeing as we are from the Great Northwest, we had never EVER had grits taste mouth watering like those! And the biscuits, please...my mouth is watering while I type this, they are phenomenal! We ate every last bite of food we ordered, it was so marvelous. I wish I could tell you when I would ever go back through Little Rock, Arkansas just to eat there again.

Fun little place! I loved the retro/modern diner decor. Food was very good. Hubby wasn't happy that it took so long for the food to come out. I was very happy with the locally sourced food and my healthy breakfast of avocado toast and berries. Hubby got the Dutchman burrito. Both were great! Good place to go if you are not in a hurry.

name: Star of India Restaurant
address: 301 N Shackleford Rd, Little Rock, AR 72211, USA
reviews: The owner said "Welcome home" as we entered. There cannot be enough good said about this place. The servers are always sweet and prompt to take care of filling your drink even when it is a buffet and they don't typically make as much. The food is incredible and the price is maybe a dollar higher than the average fast food lunch. Definitely worth a visit!

Our go-to place for Indian. We prefer to go during the buffet, which is available seven days a week. Food for the whole family, even our picky eater!

Great soup, and a variety of dishes! Large varieties of meat, vegetarian, and vegan dishes. The tofu curry is really good!

Chicken curries, lamb curries, vegetable curries, several types of naan, roasted vegetable dishes, grilled chicken, grilled fish, spinach salad.

I'm a big fan of the curried lentil, curried tofu, saag paneer. Family also loves the Tandoori chicken, Tandoori fish, curried chicken, curried chickpeas.

There is just too much food food dishes and options to list them all.

My husband and I ate here last night for the first time, and our experience was amazing!  The food was fresh and delicious, despite my pretty intense allergy to turmeric...no rash or anything, but lots of dizziness which paired quite well with my two Indian Mules, I must say ;D.  The highlight, though was the excellent service.  The manager and staff were extremely attentive and friendly.  All things paired with the beautiful, cozy ambiance of this little gem will certainly be bringing us back again and again.  Loooove this spot!

Wow. Great food, including some of my favorite goat dishes, and black tie service that's unbeatable. Our meals were ready very quickly, but came out piping hot and delicious. The garlic naan is to die for. I would wholeheartedly recommend Star of India to anyone who enjoys eating authentic Indian foods.

This is the spot! Treat yourself to the Lamb Vindaloo. Let em know of you like it spicy. They can turn up the heat. I usually just let him tell me what I want when I go here. Very nice people too! 5 stars! I'm a fan a and a regular.

name: La Terraza Rum & Lounge
address: 3000 Kavanaugh Blvd #202, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: Oh my god! This place is amazing. Juan was the best server I have had in years. Very nice guy that made you feel right at home. He brought out different runs for us to smell and gave us the history on them. The food was just out of this world. Some of the best food I have ever had. First time here and we had a great time. Please go see Juan. Thank you guys very much. We will be back soon!

I just move back to Little Rock and this is one of my favorite places to dine alfresco. The atmosphere inside is a little bright for evening dining but this is one of my favorite places in Little Rock because hearing the sounds of Puerto Rico and the Dominican republic is so refreshing to have in Little Rock. The upbeat sound of salsa makes dinner lovely while in a cozy and tranquil setting.  When my friends visit from the islands, I like to take them here.

This place is a GEM! The owner Sarah accommodated our group last minute. They have a special party room that was perfect for our group. She and her staff were incredible attentive and gave helpful suggestions. The drinks were delicious. The arrepas were yummy but the paella was INCREDIBLE! One of the best restaurants in Little Rock. Parking is on the street but easy to find. They also have outdoor seating when the weather is nice. They have happy hour specials and fun themed nights. Will definitely be back! Also, the owners are amazing! I would come back for their hospitality alone.

Had the braised beef dish with black beans, fried plantain, and fried egg.  The dish had good seasoning and flavors and the beef was juicy.  Really enjoyed the plantains and black beans too.  Would prefer a runnier egg but still tasted great.

Additionally, our server was spot on!  Excellent service and very knowledgeable.

My husband and I ate there for our 23rd anniversary.  He is a native of Venezuela and he enjoyed the food and dessert tremendously.  The staff was friendly, the food was hot and service was excellent! We will definitely be going back to enjoy more delicious entrees!

name: Copeland’s of New Orleans | Little Rock
address: 2602 S Shackleford Rd, Little Rock, AR 72205, USA
reviews: Staff excellent, lovely environment and food tasty/good value. Be prepared though, should expect a wait...maybe the could have table side bread or something to help out those who are hungry. Seafood is fresh and cheesecake really good.
Enjoyed a nice lunch. Waitstaff was great and very attentive.  Food was cooked to order.  Parking was adequate.

My family and visit Copeland today.  My daughter’s choice.  Why is it so dark.  We was seated in the aisle of the restaurant.  It was dark there was no light above us.  The waiter passed our table several times without asking did we need anything ( water is what we needed).  Salad came with the entree.  Sad to say my visit was not meet satisfying results today
By far my favorite restaurant. The ambiance is perfect for date night and the creole menu is delicious! Plan on a 20 minute wait, but it's worthwhile. Have a drink at the bar while you wait!

Copelands is our go-to-place for unplanned celebrations! No reservations, ever. Excellent food. Reasonable prices. Beautiful ambience. Great service.
Can't ask for more!

name: All Aboard Restaurant & Grill
address: 6813 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72207, USA
reviews: The food was hot and made to order, the fried pickles were still crunchy, the hush puppies were wonder, according to my husband, who is very picky with his hush puppies. My chicken pita was wonderful. Our daughter enjoyed her burger. The train was really cool. And the house ranch was great. No complaints here. Going to have to bring the family sometime.

Great experience! The atmosphere is wonderful!! Kids of all ages love it here, even the teenagers and adults!!! I love going and taking other children that have never gone. They get so excited watching and waiting for their food to arrive. The older children like to try and figure out how it works.

This is a special place for kids and adults who enjoy trains and good food! It's a fun and novel experience with friendly service. I won't spoil all the fun but go find out their special tableside delivery! The food is also yummy. We tried the burgers, Mac and cheese, pizza, and chicken sandwich and everyone enjoyed their meal!
Loved it! First time coming! They have extra long booths for big families! Reasonably priced and kid friendly! Food was good!
Awsome place to bring kids. My kids loved the train play area. Enjoyed the food delivery by train. I reccomend All Aboard and will visit again.

name: Riverfront Steakhouse
address: 2 Riverfront Pl, North Little Rock, AR 72114, USA
reviews: Was with a large party (about 30) in the large room. Had one waiter for all 30. He was great but it took forever to get our meals and forever to pass them out. Food was cold when we were ready. Should have allowed for at least 2 people to help. I had blackened chicken and wife a steak. Chicken was flavorless...basically just a extra well cooked semi charred piece of chicken. Seemed to have no seasoning on it like you would think "blackened" would have - it was 2$ extra for the blackened. Steak was tough and not worth the cost. The 1 star came from the salad bar - it was good. I should have just got that. I was not the only one that had issues with the food. This was my first visit and my last.....
Excellent service nice wine selection and the desserts are delicious

Went for valentine's day with my husband.  We had a great time and, as always,  the food was fantastic!  Great service,  as well.  Its pricey, so we don't go often.  But when we go for special occasions,  it never disappoints!!

The steak was fantastic. The service we received from our waiter Stephen was not however. Out of our party of four, only one steak was cooked how we asked for it. I asked the manager as he was going by if we could get our correct steaks. No problem. However when Stephen our waiter came back he made a passive aggressive comment about how he would’ve liked the chance to fix the situation himself. Serving assistant chip was fantastic as well. I think Stephen might have been an outlier.
Server was very friendly! Salad bar was outstanding. The filet was slightly over cooked and had a very strong pepper coating.

name: Benihana
address: 2 Riverfront Pl, North Little Rock, AR 72114, USA
reviews: It was..  very good.  I eat at many central Arkansas hibachi.  The servers were extremely polite and courteous.  The food was delicious and we'll put together.  The steak was outstanding, the veggies were delicious and the shrimp were perfect.  Highly recommended.

My daughter and I hadn't had hibachi in a while. We really enjoyed the food, ambiance and most of all our chef Mr. Long💖😍👍💕Although we had to wait over 30 minutes after we were seated. He made our experience EXTRA SPECIAL 💓💫😁😄😋

This was the 3rd time I've been to Benihana and have not been disappointed yet. The chefs are entertaining and the food is excellent. The portions are spot on. I like that you end up with people you don't know at the table which make for some pretty interesting conversations.
Service & food is always great! You can't go wrong with the lunch specials. Whatever your food preferences there is something for you.

First time going and I have to say I was impressed. Mind you it's a loud atmosphere so be ready to turn around and see what's happening. The food, of course, was great and it's always a keen type of entertainment when you see how they cook and prepare the food. It's mostly cooked well to where soy sauce is not a heavy need. And yes they do all the food tricks. Good for the family or even a couple's date.

name: Allsopp & Chapple Restaurant + Bar
address: 311 Main St, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: The food was was really good and the atmosphere was nice. One of the cocktails we had was good and the other was gross. We liked the Great Gatsby and would recommend. Our waiter made a couple of mistakes with our order, but they made them right each time.
Great service and great food. Nice job.

Came on a Monday night and was not disappointed in food or service. The atmosphere was the usual low light calm with background music of most upscale American bistros, which is perfect for fine dinning in my opinion. The place was had only 3-4 other tables one of which was Asa Hutchinson (our current governor)so I assume he enjoys it. My table had the Veal chop, shrimp and grits, wagyu short rib, and red snapper(I think). Everything was close to perfect. My veal chop was cooked a little much, no pink in the middle, but it was still delicious and I hate to be "that guy" so no biggie. The smoked Gouda grits were amazing. The short rib was so tender you could cut it with a spoon. The shrimp and grits and red snapper were cooked perfectly as well, highly recommend. All our plates were wiped Clean and we were all satisfied. For cocktails we had the Animal farm bacon bourbon old fashioned and the Night to remember a mezcal with apricot liquor and blue berry lavender syrup. Both obviously delicious.

My server, Austin, was the best! Beyond excellent customer service, he made suggestions that were right on point. In fact, the entire team was really friendly, and made sure we had a great experience. Oh, and the food was pricey but DELICIOUS.
The food and service was great! Loved the duck and the short ribs. The Catch 22 is also delicious.

name: Flying Saucer Draught Emporium
address: 323 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Besides having more beers than you could ask for, Flying Saucer also has some really good food.  Lauren's Goat Cheese Salad (pictured, with chicken added for an additional fee) is one of my favorite salads in Little Rock. They also have several sandwiches that my husband brags on. Their appetizer list is pretty awesome, especially their Loaded Rocket Tots! We like the atmosphere as well.  The front area is great for sunny days, with tons of windows.

Highly recommend this place. The German plate and fries were excellent. The bratwurst reminded me of Germany. My girlfriend really enjoyed her cheese fries as well. The atmosphere was really welcoming, the server was very friendly and the beer was great.

Pretty good place, service , food and drink. They also have a very nice beer selection.

It is also located in a very good spot in downtown nearby a bunch of cool attractions.

Food: Reuben-Esque Sandwich + 2 sunny side eggs (this was a custom order I asked)
Drink: Local IPA beer

I have always enjoyed each of my visits to this establishment. Lots and lots of beers on tap! Definitely always try to swing by here for a different brew each time I'm in Little Rock. Really cool atmosphere too! Located right in the middle of downtown Little Rock.

Great place to get a bite or a drink. Their drink selection is vast, and they have $4 taps all day Monday and 4-7pm Tues-Fri. Their food is exceptional as well. It's a bit of a pound environment, so don't expect a quiet place, but it's a bar; what do you expect? I highly recommend.

name: 42 Bar and Table
address: 1200 President Clinton Ave, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: Had lunch here with a new friend from the Ultimate Travel Writers Workshop. The outdoor location was cool in the shade and perfect even in the heat of the day.  Had Fish and Chips. It was awesome!  Had to deduct 1 star with the fly attack that accompanied serving of the meal.  Fortunately a breeze flew in and drove than away.  Otherwise it was a great lunch and I will be back.

Went for lunch..had the smoked brisket and sweet potato fries....outstanding! Will definitely be back to try the brunch menu. 
Oh..the carrot cake was delicious too..a bit pricey but good nonetheless.

excellent southern brunch. They have a very nice shrimp and grits as you'd expect. I had the crab cake Benedict which was way too decadent but absolutely up to snuff. The chicken and waffles is quite good, as are the beignets which are definitely worthwhile. The pricing is very reasonable and the atmosphere is upscale with nice views of the Arkansas River as well as the garden and a very nice patio that is shaded by the library itself. My daughter ate all of her Nutella crepes and they also have a good selection of a la carte.

First let me say that the bartender was worth visiting again. He was nice, entertaining, and made a great negroni. Also, the filet was excellent. Those reasons are why this place gets 3 stars. It got dinged because our server actually complained about us bringing in our own wine(which I'm pretty sure is not illegal) and he proceeded to do a piss-poor opening and presentation after we told him we could just open ourselves if he was going to be so put out by it. UGH. He also vocalized his frustration at us paying and tipping the bartender before we sat down so that he missed that tip. Dude, you didn't mix our drinks and entertain us, bartender did. Bartender gets the tip. He tried to recover with light banter but had already lost us as an audience. Several slightly snide comments later he tells us that we were supposed to be one of his VIP tables(humble brag). Could have fooled us, buddy! I hate to see how he treats the rude tables if that were true. Also, we felt rushed. Here's the deal, we like to eat, drink, and talk and are happy to pay for the privilege to do so in your establishment. We do not want to feel unwelcome or hurried. The biggest hint that it was time for us to leave was when our server told us that we probably wouldn't want any of the desserts that he had left and he didn't want to bother the kitchen. OOOOkkkkaaayyyy. Never mind then. Turned out that the kitchen was not bothered a bit and sent out a sampler plate. And they were all good. Winner. Too late to order a cup of coffee though, it wasn't ten o'clock yet. Then the valet came up to our table, asked if this was the key to our car, tossed it on the table, and turned tail. Saved that tip money, I guess. 

We have been baffled lately by some of the poor service we've received at some of the pricier restaurants in town and 42 is not immune to this epidemic. 

Again, bartender was cool. Food was good. Server was neither. Valet was lame. Get it together, team.
Food is great and reasonably priced. Also, the personnel is very accommodating with large parties.

name: Kontiki African Restaurant
address: 3901 S University Ave, Little Rock, AR 72204, USA
reviews:
Excellent food. We ordered a lot of different items off the menu, including all of the appetizers and some of the specials of the day.

Everyone in the party thought it was really exceptional food. I liked the peanut soup with beef the best. I was really blown away by how delicious it was. 

Would definitely come back and recommend you try it if you've never been.
Excellent service, vibrating music and all above tasty food. I simply enjoy eating there. Love it!

First time here, can’t believe it has been open for 2 years and we didn’t know it. It was fantastic! We brought our kids and they enjoyed it as well. They have food for everyone, even picky eaters. Their okra rice and pepper soup were my favorites!

Can’t help but order the Peanut Stew every time (beef is much more flavorful than chicken to me) but the jollof Rice is also amazing, and the plantains are delicious. I’ve never gone wrong at Kontiki. Ginger beer is very strong, which is a good thing in my opinion, but may be too much for some.

I really liked the cleanliness of the restaurant & it seemed family friendly. That being said, it was a little sterile. There was no music playing and I expected to feel emerged in an West African type of experience. I had the couscous & chicken. The food had generous portions of couscous and fresh vegetables, but the chicken didn't seem to be marinated in the sauce (which there wasn't enough of). The waitress was nice & brought me my water, but never came by my table to refill my drink or to ask how the food was. I hope they expand their menu and add items like chicken yasa, provide Maggi sauce, or popular African deserts. I will definitely give this restaurant another chance and maybe try another dish.

name: The House Of Mental
address: 801 S Chester St Suite 1, Little Rock, AR 72201, USA
reviews: This place is insanely good. The cauliflower wings are delicious and crispy and the mac-no-cheese BLEW ME AWAY. I'm still sitting here trying to figure out how it tastes so good. I highly recommend supporting this small business!! ❤
I got the kale, buffalo and Asian cauliflower wings, and the spaghetti. Everything was Awesome! I will most definitely be going back. Anyone who eats there will not be disappointed.
Delicious food, friendly service. Cozy environment driven by a mission to spread health. THIS IS A GREAT BUSINESS TO SUPPORT!
She literally had the best vegan food! and them sweet potatoes are amazing 😫❤️🔥
The MacNOCheese is jaw-dropping delicious! And the portions are huge!  I'm already planning my next meal there!

name: Buffalo Grill
address: 1611 Rebsamen Park Rd, Little Rock, AR 72211, USA
reviews: You gotta "Shuffle on Down" to the Buffalo Grill! Absolutely  love this place! Hands down, my favorite burger joint of all time! I have been coming here since I was a child and will continue coming here so long as I live. Everytime I'm in Little Rock I make sure to stop by here and eat. Never disappointed and not a thing on the menu I don't like! Be sure to try the Cheese Dip and Chips, you won't be disappointed!

Been here a couple times. It's good, and certainly better than fast food. Service friendly and fast. Portions generous and love the French fries. Wish they toasted the hamburger buns though...they tend to get way too soggy, especially if getting lots of toppings.

Amazing experience. And great food. Had the hamburger steak, awesome. I was there with 16 others for a birthday party, it was a sunday night and we just kinda popped in, not only did they accommodate us, they went out of the way to help my handicapped father. The owner was hands on and friendly. Just great family atmosphere.
Turkey club is the best. Huge drinking cups and nice servers. There is an downstairs seating area that’s typically less packed, head to the back in the left and the second set of stairs.
Great food, very friendly staff! Cozy atmosphere, love the ambiance. One of my favorite places to eat!
